text: We always make our way here when we visit Vegas. Never disappoints, always delicious and plenty of food for everyone. Server was nice and attentive.

My husband and I both ordered the oxtail dinner.  It came with a choice of three sides.  We got mashed potatoes and gravy, collard greens, and macaroni and cheese.  Everything was absolutely delicious!!  And portions are HUGE.  definitely worth the money. Service was friendly and fast.  We will definitely be back.

Everytime I'm in Las Vegas I go here for some great soul food. The meatloaf is abundant and tasty and the fried chicken is just like Grandma used to make. They give you three sides with each meal and it's so much food there's no way to eat it all. I haven't tried the pork chop dinner yet, but it looks great and I'm excited to try it next time I'm in town. The wait staff is very friendly and helpful.

This place is a real gem! I had the catfish, which was a bit too salty, but delicious (hey, it's soul food after all). The cornbread was the best I've ever had. 

The service was prompt and very friendly, as was the rest of the crowd. As a transracial family with an adopted son from Haiti, we weren't sure what kind of reception we would receive in a soul food restaurant. It was not an issue. We felt very welcomed, and EllaEm's does a great job of demonstrating pride in their heritage. 

It was a great experience overall, and we will definitely be back!
Good one of the better soul food places in Las Vegas!

The food is probably the best soul food I ever had. Got fried chicken,red beans,greens and black eye peas.It was amazing although I had to have a doggy bag because the portions are big. Staff was very kind and friendly. Definitely will be back..Best in Soul Food in Las Vegas

Great food. The meat fell right off the bones of my smothered chicken. My dining partner's fried catfish was perfect, both seasoning and texture. They have delicious greens, yams, and red beans as well.

Only problem was the service. It was maybe half full, but the two on staff seemed a little overwhelmed. My hopeful guess is that their experienced wait staff works the busier days.

OMG! Great Soul Food.  Our first time there today and will definitely go back.
Had the catfish, which was perfect and the best collard greens I have ever eaten.
Be sure and try the yams too, oh so yummy!! They also know how to make sweet
tea, and portions are large. Service was GREAT!

I have been really wanting to try this restaurant for a while, but every time I would try and go they would be closed. When I thought about them this time they were just getting ready to close. So we ordered and took the food home. It was just ok, there was nothing exciting about the food. Everything could have used more flavor. I don't think it made that much difference that we took the food home. 

We ordered the Catfish, Snapper and Meatloaf dinners(which came with three sides each.) All of them were dry and needed more flavor. The meatloaf, 1/2 inch thick with gravy, almost seemed like it was processed and had no juice, flavor, texture or color (like bell peppers, onions, tomato anything. The Snapper and Catfish were both fried and were very thinly cut. 

They give you a nice amount of food for the cost. We had Mac & Cheese, Black Eye Peas, Fried Cabbage, Greens, and Yams. I loved the fried cabbage. The Yams were good, but could have used a tad more nutmeg. The meal came with cornbread muffins that were dry and boring. 

The Black Eye Peas just tasted like Peas, and my 10 year old makes better Mac and Cheese. Not only could I not find the cheese but I could find any flavor. It was not the traditional Black Mac and Cheese that is baked with cheese. Greens were ok, nothing to discuss. 

The worst part was the Peach Cobbler. I was excited when I saw the Peach Cobbler picture on the website, it looked delicious and flavorful. Instead of Peach Cobbler, I received two bowls of dough with maybe two peaches. I warmed it up for 45 secs like they suggested but that did not make any difference. It tasted like peach flavored bread, not like a cobbler at all. 

The only thing that was good, was the service. They were friendly when I placed the order over the phone and when I picked it up.

I've been in Las Vegas for a year not going out to eat much but I love oxtails. My sister came to visit last wknd from Cali and I found this place looking for bbq. The people are friendly and the oxtails were very good. Will be going back to try other items.

I'm from Mississippi, but I have lived overseas for a few years.. I am in Vegas for a while and the choices for food are very vast! When I discovered a soul food place I didn't think it could be anything like home, but this place pleasantly surprised me... Man, am I happy! I haven't had greens like this since I was a kid! They even have the pepper sauce on the table! I know the catfish Capitol of the world is in Belzoni, but this place gives it a run for its money!! Everything seems to be made with love in your granny's kitchen. I will keep coming back here because it feels like home, and that is good for my SOUL!!!

I ordered the chicken and waffles. The chicken was so good, I was going to completely ignore the waffle. But the waffle was also amazing, a perfect compliment to the chicken. I also really enjoyed the kool aid and the cornbread pancakes.

Found them tucked away while searching for a quick bite for me and two kiddos under 4. Short and sweet...this is the purest and freshest soul I've had in a while and we just moved from the south. Firstly,  we were greeted by a really nice staff who had recommendations ready.  I went with the fried cat fish and chose mac n cheese, collard greens, black eyed peas, and an extra side of fried okra. The meal also came with corn bread muffins and they even gave me a couple extra for the kids and my hubby who had the leftovers. The muffins were moist and light in sweetness and density,  delicious and balanced. The fried fish and okra had a great batter and were cooked perfectly and didn't have an oily taste. The collards and beans were so fresh, not fatty, and tasted great; my kids loved them. My kids didn't go for the mac n cheese, but only because their taste buds are ruined by the boxed stuff. I will be back again.  There aren't many choices along Craig for those nights I don't feel like cooking and you can go easy on the wallet and waist line if you split the meal and get an extra side ir two or you can go grilled and stick to veggie options. The desserts looked great...maybe next time.

This place is great! I'm coming from Detroit and the soul food here is on point.  To compare,  I ordered the fire chicken meal which you can select two sides.  I chose the rice with gravy and veggies.  I also got a side of the Mac N Cheese. The chicken had the best seasoning and was perfectly cooked. The Mac n cheese was awesome!  We also ordered their corn bread which were baked in a cup like a cupcake.  I felt like I lost alot of the bread with it getting stuck to the paper.  Otherwise,  really good.  

The ambience is quite dark... But the service is great.  We got our food a little bit before closing and they were so welcome to let us dine in.  

Great place for the soul food cravings

The service was excellent!! The food was delicious. I had the catfish and it was yummy, fried nice and crispy and juicy!! My sides where yams, greens and red beans and rice!  Yams were seasoned perfectly, greens were very flavorful and the red beans and rice was full of perfect combination of spices!  I will definitely come back again!  My hunnie had the smothered chicken with brown gravy, it was a good balance of seasonings and the gravy was full of flavor, it definitely provided a good balance to the chicken!!  He also had yams, greens, and he had black eyed peas which was delicious !!!  The cornbread muffin they serve reminding me of my mama!! So definitely 2 thumbs up!!  We will be back!!

Went in on our last night in Vegas, so it wasn't crowded. The service was good & the place was neat & clean. We had oxtail. Short ribs, fried chicken, snapper, greens, fried okra, candied yams, rice & gravy, Mac & cheese and fried cabbage. Everything was superb!! The food had lots of seasoning & flavor to it. We're definitely going back there when we come back to Vegas!!! Thank you Ellaem's for making our last night a memorable one!!
Best soul food in Vegas by far!!! Great service!! Thanks Alyson and Q! I enjoyed the Ox tails and baby back ribs. Boom!!

I'm writing this review while waiting for our order. My husband and I got a craving for some fried catfish, and being near our house and having it once before, we called this place for take out. Now, the food is good. Not outstanding but good and just a little pricey. Still, convenience and cravings win out. But this is my complaint, we called in an order for pick up. We wanted to avoid the wait and have a night in. Asked if it would be ready by 6:30, I called at called at 5:40, they said yes. My husband got there ten minutes late and he is still there waiting for our food thirty minutes later. Bad service? Yes...


*** update- after waiting thirty more minutes for our takeout, a food server just sets the bag of food in front of my husband without a word and walks away. No courtesy what so ever.

First time here. Service was great and the food was good! We had the oxtail dinner and meatloaf lunch special. The fried cabbage was spectacular! Sweet Tea wasn't great but I will definitely come back again!

I typically don't write reviews but in this case, I'd have to. My family of 5 came in as soon as the place opened. It took us over an hour to get our food. With 3 little kids, that didn't go so well. There was only 1 waitress for the entire place. During the time we were waiting on our food, there were 2 different group of customers that walked out because of how slow everything was. 
I ordered the oxtail, which was pretty tasty (a bit salty for my taste though). My husband ordered the fried fish, wasn't too bad and my oldest ordered the chicken and waffles, which I found disappointing as 3 or 4 chicken wings were given(I was expecting big chicken pieces for the price we paid), scrambled eggs and a stack of waffles. Everything was a bit pricey. If you're craving for soul food, I'd recommend this place; however, I don't think I'll be back again due to lack of good service and long wait.

The waitress Jazzland was awesome. My mother and grandma came in from Ohio and she showed us some true hospitality. The food is also good, but the service will have me back! Ask for her it's worth it!

My husband and I stumbled upon EllaEm's randomly one night. The service was top notch. I ordered the Fried Chicken sandwich and my husband ordered the Smoothered Chicken. I am giving the location a 3-star only because I wasn't a big fan of the sandwich. My husband truly enjoyed his dish. From what I was able to try without being attacked, my husband's Smoothered Chicken was great! I noticed everyone says you have to try the gravy, yes the gravy is good. I however, LOVED the corn bread.
Excellent food and great customer service. Visited on 5/25/16. The owner should be very proud. Visitor's from Washington D.C. and Tifton, GA.

If I could pick 1/2 a star I would, my little cousin ordered the chicken strips. Half way through the chicken strips she mentions that the chicken tasted funny, my aunt checks the chicken and the chicken is raw. So we notify the waitress and she was very understanding and apologetic and offered to compensate us for the raw chicken (like any professional waitress would do). Long story short whoever the manager is made us pay for the replacement meal, this is a perfect example of bad customer service. If my 9 year old cousin gets sick from eating this establishments raw chicken we will be seeing you in court.

For starters four of us walked in and all four orders were wrong then we get home we check to see the orders and we took a bite out of somebody else's food brought it back to them and they tried to give it to the customer when he showed up if it weren't for the fact that he said I want my food fresh he could have brawl we know gotten age from somebody's food that they got taken out of the store and brought back. Then the attitude that the girl up front and Davis when we asked for you know something and compensation for being screwed over she said that we didn't tip and that's why it was order was screwed up. In all honesty we gave her a cheerleader $6 for $40 ticket I mean she got tipped well so in my opinion what are the worst places in town... I give the food to the service of a half a point and the restaurant cleanliness 1.

Julian, This place Is The best In The West for real.  When you want Soul food At It's
Core, Go there once, and You'll go back for more.
This place has great soul food, my chicken was a little salty for my taste but , yams, beans ect were delicious.
Delicious place to eat.  Alison is a wonderful waitress and very friendly.  Second day in a row we decided to come back for more.

Fried chicken, rice and gravy, cabbage and Mac and Cheese was great! Also tried the collard greens and ribs. Everything was delicious! Kyle, our server, was very nice and attentive. Can't wait to go back!

I was looking for a place that served liver and onions in Las Vegas. I googled it and it listed this place that only a few miles away. My husband I went for dinner and we were welcomed when we walked in. Our waiter was great. Service was great and my liver & onions was just the way I like them. Also got collard greens, Mac n cheese and mashed. Husband got pork chops, 3 of them. We were shocked. Great meal, met new friends and were so full we  could barely walk, no room for dessert.

Just finished my first lunch here. Ordered the catfish sandwich for pick-up which was ready in a timely manner. 

Greens were on point. 
Catfish was on point.
Cornbread was on point. 

Will order again.
I went there yesterday from hearing from a friend the food was great .great customer service I love seafood so the red snapper was on hit too bad I'm not from the area

Really good soul food only been here a couple times today I got the fried chicken with mashed potatoes, collard greens and Mac n cheese everything was finger licking good I've also gotten the catfish before I just love this place it's worth the wait every time and make sure to come hungry the portions are big but you'll eat every bite!

Went during their lunch special hours and everything was  great! Good customer service, great food and nice prices.

Catfish & chicken and waffles 

Will recommend to friends and family.

I've only been here once for lunch and the food was really good. The only reason I don't give it five stars is due to the dining area. They need to rearrange how the room is set up in my opinion. When you walk in, it's not clear if it's a take out place or not. Other than that, the staff was nice and the food was good.

A solid offering in the Soul Food/Southern category. The food is good. Admittedly, I have had better fried chicken elsewhere, but EllaEm's does it justice. Also tried the fried fish - great!  Not too greasy.  Southern food wouldn't be complete without sides, and here, EllaEm's also shines. Collard greens, mac and cheese, red beans, black eyed peas - all excellent! IMO, the standout was the yams.  

I didn't have a problem with the service here, unlike others' experience.  It was a bit on the slow side - so not good if you're in a time crunch. However, the staff are friendly.  I think this is a family business, which I'm always fond of supporting whenever possible.

Decor is casual, and the price isn't too bad (especially for Vegas standards).

I ordered two pork chop plates and peach cobbler to go. When I got home there was no peach cobbler or any rice. I had to drive back which took me 25mins. Upon returning the waitress with the short gold ponytail who took order was rude. She grabbed bags sent the food back in the kitchen which I thought was unsanitary and yelled for the cooks to put rice on top of my pork chops. I asked if they were allowed to do so and she said yes. She was very unprofessional and mad at me as if it was my fault that my order was incorrect. She threw everything back in the back and gave me a free peach which was watery. The pork chops were tough as you can see I ate one and gave rest to my dog. I spent $41.06 for nothing had I not drove back before I would have driven back to get my refund!!!

This restaurant is worth getting off the strip. The portions are HUGE. My boyfriend had the Catfish dinner with 3 sides of Mac-n-cheese, yams and rice smothered with gravy. I had the catfish sandwich with fries. The catfish is amazing, succulent and spiced just right. (We went to a much more expensive Southern restaurant later in the week and I ordered the catfish which was dryed out!) 
The sides including the fries were all wonderful. We will definitely go back later this year when we're in Vegas again.  We're dying for the catfish again and try some new items! 
I highly recommend making the 20 minute drive to North Las Vegas to eat here and then hit one of the Station Casinos as well.

OMG it was off the hook!!!Everything me and my husband ate was bomb! The mac-n-cheese is heaven on earth! The yams was like a party in my mouth and the ribs good lawd they were like silk on my tongue.will be back everytime we are in vegas. Customer service was on point also.
Had lunch 1/30/15, was awesome food. Reminded me if great food from the south. I had the meat loaf with the "Red sauce"...yummy! My waiter "Q" was very helpful..knew what to order! JV

If you're in north town and craving some good ol' fashioned soul food, you definitely gotta try this place out! Their prices are good for the amount you get and the inside is very clean and welcoming, considering the poor location choice, which is in a plaza on Craig road and Revere -where stores are constantly closing and new businesses open left and right. If it is your first time and want something other than their really good fried chicken, YOU MUST TRY THE FRIED CATFISH! I don't know what they do to the catfish, but there is no fishy taste at all. (you know what I'm talking about) It's very clean tasting and the seasoning and batter is not overpowering, making this light crispy fish a must try. The sides totally compliment the food and leave me stuffed and satisfied. If you're thinking this is just your ordinary soul food joint think again, there's plenty of SOUL and HEART stirring up in this kitchen.
This place is fantastic, the food is delicious and Kim was outstanding in assisting us. We will definitely return for a visit when we're in Las Vegas!!!
We came all way from the bay area, the food and service was the bomb!!!! Shout out Q, he had good service and great hospitality,  wonderful personality,  food was hot and fresh love love love it

I was Visiting Vegas for my Girls B day and we stopped in hoping to have some great soul food and Ella Ems did not disapoint ! The wait staff was very friendly  and we were seated quickly and with a smile! I order the Catfish , mac and cheese and greens and every bite was delish! There portions are huge and prices are very good! I could not finish everything and had to take some back with me but it was so good @ 3am coming back from a long night out! If great Soul Food is what your in the Mood for make sure u pay this spot a Visit !!

The food was outstanding the atmosphere was stellar cozy comfortable made me feel like I was back at home in Greensboro North Carolina and the service was exemplary especially this one waitress named Allison she was fast efficient courteous lovely effervescent smile and extremely friendly. This is one place that I tell you you have to take your family and friends the prices were affordable and that's a sticking point with me because so many so called soul food restaurants in Las Vegas the food is so overpriced its not even funny but here the food is extremely well priced and you get great portions so hats off to this great establishment 20 stars in my book I'll be back!

Great Soul Food - Highly Recommend!
 - Vegas does not offer a lot of great soul food spots and after dining at M&M, this is the only soul food place in town. 
- The prices are reasonable. 
- The OX Tails are my FAV!!

* Dislike:  Toward the end of the night within the last half hour -they toss out the FOOD, I guest to clean up.  So you may not be able to buy certain foods at the end of the day.

Ella Ems  is a nice restaurant very clean. I ordered the oxtail with and entree you get three sides. I chose the yams , mash potato's and mac n cheese. , you think i got enough carbs?
               The oxtails were excellant meaty ,tender  and moist in a very good brown gravy. Portion size on the oxtails were small , I received 3 med sized pieces. Mash potatos  were solid . Yams were amazing , very flavorful. Some of the best yams ever ate. The mac n cheese on the other hand were very disappointing. No cheese flavor very, very bland. They also serve cornbread which was very good , a little sweet, how us yankee's like it as my mother in law would say. Overall pretty happy with the meal

I expected the food to be really good but it just okay. I wouldnt recommend or go back. I ordered 5 meals for my family to go. So we had just about every side they offer on the menu. The only thing good was the potato salad and cornbread. The meats were good, the chicken and pork chops. The service was pretty decent. Also not sure if it was just the day we were there, but it was HOT in there. Also they offered a few different dessert but was out of all of them. i thought that was odd. The servers and cashiers were really nice.
Great service even though the place was packed and there was only one waitress.  Awesome lunch menu.

Home style at its best! Gave the true sense of comfort food with every bite. I entered hungry, grossly overate from the generous portions, and left miserably satisfied and overwhelmingly content. What more can a man ask for?

We have been reading reviews for Ellla Ems for some time now and always wanted to try it. This past Sunday we were planning on trying breakfast at the new "Lumberjack's" restaurant on Craig rd. but when we arrived there was a 30 minute wait and we decided to see if Ella Ems served breakfast. They do not really serve breakfast but the waiter recommend the chicken & waffles which you could order with or without 2 eggs. All 3 in our party ordered the chicken and waffles with eggs. Everything came out hot, and everything on the plate was delicious. The fried chicken was excellent, the waffle fresh and a good size, two eggs were cooked just how we ordered them. We will be back to try the rest of the menu.
Amazing food !! The first bite took me back home to the South !! Best Fried Chicken ! We will definitely be coming here frequently

I've been here a couple of times the food is always great I just started trying the OXTAIL and it's amazing. This is an all around great place I would recommend to anyone. The customer service is wonderful I had the pleasure of being served by two lovely young ladies Anisha and Allison they make me feel like family :). Thank you will be back!

I like this place, good atmosphere,  good music, good food and pretty waitresses Navi and Anisha. I had the fried catfish and macaroni &cheese greens and fries. Fries were great, catfish better then Mari os. Will return

EllaEm's catered an event for us last week and it was out of this world. All of our friends are from the south east and they could not quit raving about how awesome the food was! Fried chicken, mac&cheese, greens, red beans, okra, potato salad--- all perfect! If you want real, southern soul food with amazing customer service, this is your place!

Omg.... If I could've given more stars I would. Being from the southeast I am picky about southern food. My Boyfriend and I both ordered the smothered fried chicken. The chicken was perfectly crispy and juicy. The gravy was tasty. Our sides were fresh and delicious. We ended our meal with the peach cobbler. It was perfect! Even the atmosphere was soothing. Great place for a date or family dinner.
This place is DELICIOUS!!! Allyson was great as our server. The yams are amazing. We will definitely come back again!!  ;-)

We decided to have dinner here on Friday night after reading some of the reviews. 
My fiancée is from NC so his taste buds are hard to please when it comes to southern food. Upon entering there were 3 ladies (servers I assume, they were all wearing black) and one couple having dinner. The decor is nice and enjoyed the "home-like" feeling of the Granny pictures. They must have satellite radio and the best radio station ever, it was warm, inviting, and even a little romantic at times with the selection of music, soul, jazz and R&B. The server immediately came to our table and took our drink order. My Fiancée had the fried chicken dinner with greens, Mac n cheese and yams. I enjoyed the catfish with the same three sides except I had the mashed potatoes instead of yams. They were all very large portions, the food was nice and hot and yes, everyone is right, the corns bread is pretty yummy...................but can we talk about the catfish????
Even if you are not a fish lover, you should try this!!!! It is crispy on the outside, the breading or whatever they use is not to thick or overpowering, it's perfectly seasoned and crunchy, but wait, when you get to the fish.....OH MY! It is like butter; it melts in your mouth and is so delicious you would never even think it is fish. Definitely the best WE have ever had (yes I had to share, the meal was large)
I am not from the south, but have visited NC and eaten catfish at many other places before and this is by far the best I have ever had. The server, ( I am sorry I do not remember her name) was also very helpful, when I explained this was our first time there and may need assistance suggesting dessert, was very pleasant and helpful. As they got busier, (many people were coming in to pick up to-go orders) and three more parties came in, we were constantly checked by the other servers, asking not only if we were ok but if there was anything else they can get for us.
Overall, we were extremely happy and will definitely go back!

I absolutely love this place. The oxtails are delicious & so is the fried cabbage. Que has such a great personality & is very personable. 
It's definitely worth the drive!

The food's great but the service leaves something to be desired.

One time for dinner, we waited for an hour for our food. After inquiring as to the status, they said it was still another 10 minutes. We just paid for our drinks and cornbread and left.

We've been here a couple of times before but this'll be the last; the service has gradually gotten worse.

The review was updated from a 5 star.

Keeping the same 3 stars. Today I tried their fried chicken and same 3 sides as last time. The chicken was good. The yams and greens are great. The Mac n cheese is the nastiest Mac n cheese I've ever tasted. It's pretty much plain macaroni with some clumps of fake cheese that doesn't coat the macaroni. The corn bread muffins are still way too small. I will still get some veggies from this place but that's about it.

Mrs. A..... I have read the "Complaint" that you have wrote and I have come to this conclusion.... You are NOT keeping it real, you are just the bitter "ex-worker" who got fired... I find this VERY unprofessional of you. I'm not going to go back and forth with you, but because you posted your childish complaint with my name, I felt the NEED to reply. - Keep this in mind - "To Each is his own" - My experience, If you want some good soul food, great atmosphere, good owner as well as servers and cooks... Go to EllaEm's and try it out for yourself....

*Be aware of bitter ex-servers, they'll sabotage anything... Smoooccchheeezz!

This place is great!  I usually go to M & M's when I want soul food, but I was on the complete opposite side of town. I found this place and I love it! 

I had my 2 year old with me and most waiters I'm sure cringe at my active 2 year old, but my waitress was great! Every time she came to our table she played with him. I never had to ask for a refill and she was very kind.

The food was great! My son and I shared the smothered chicken lunch special with mac and cheese and greens, and it was very filling! My son is picky but he loved the chicken and mac too!

We will definitely be back!
Very nice place if you love soul food.  Loved especially the catfish.  All food was fresh and the hot food was indeed piping hot.  Great service as well.  Will be coming back there when possible!

First time trying but will definitely will be back to try more .I had the rack of ribs , with Mac and cheese,fried cabbage and a peach cobbler . Everything I had delicious ! Next time I'm wanting to try the oxtail
The Ox tails are to die for. I went here away from the strip after looking for soul food. It did not disappoint. This is the best soul food I have ever eaten.

I have been to this restaurant plenty of times and I have never been disappointed. It has an intimate coffee shop vibe to it. It's a great place for a date, lunch with friends, family or co-workers. Normally spend time gossiping over a plate of authentic soul food. The cornbread here is buttery, fresh and baked to perfection. I can never get  enough of that. The entree comes with 2-3 sides which are plentiful. 
They do not take long making your food at all. It's a very homestyle feel. The customer service is perfect. They aren't over bubbly, in your face or checking on you too much. 

Ella Em's is outstanding! 5/5
This place is awesome! Super nice and really accommodating. We came in with  a group of 12 and they totally took care of us.  The chicken was fantastic and I loved the corn bread!
A good neighborhood soul food place. Good food. Good service. Good environment. Relaxing.
Really good southern food. Great place for all your cravings for soul food. Gotta give it up to miss ella em.
I am from Louisiana an I can say they have sum of the best fried catfish I've had here in Vegas. I didn't care too much for the Mac n cheese, but the fried cabbage an yams were definitely on point...

Awesome and amazing doesn't do justice!!!! We had never been before but we are certainly going back. Three people three different meals three amazingly happy people! 
The fried chicken was the best I have ever had from a restaurant. The cat fish was beyond expectations! The oxtail was so good! With each entree you get three sides. The cabbage and greens were the best I have ever had (please don't tell my mom and Granny). The mac and cheese was homemade and so good! The yams made me long for Thanksgiving! 
Yet the best part of this entire place was the service!!! Kimberly was so friendly and warm. She gave great suggestions on the food and was spot on!

This is hands down the best soul food in Vegas. My husband and I have been here 10 times. The food is true southern cooking, not too salty, seasoned just right!! I can't even tell you what to get EVERYTHING we've ordered has been spot on.  The only reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is related to their to go service. We have ordered take out 3 times, all those times they forgot to put the cornbread in the bag! There cornbread is DELICIOUS!! If you've ever had it, you understand my frustration! No biggie tho, I should've learned my lesson after the first n started checking the bag,  now if we order to go, we check the bag before we leave. 
The staff is always friendly. I would definitely recommend trying this place if you're looking for some good authentic soul food. 
Be sure to check your bag before u leave with takeout!!

I had a great meal at EllaEms today.  The fried chicken with gravy on the side, mac & cheese, collard greens, and cornbread were all delicious. My waitress (I can't remember her name) was awesome. She kept the refills coming she made sure that we were well taken care of and she was very friendly and courteous.
This is one of the best places to eat authentic soul food. Food and service was beyond attentive.

This is a small place in a strip mall. It only seats 47 people. The sweet tea sucks. I can critique it being I grew up on it. Now, The menu is simple. This time I got the pork chops smothered (gravy of course)....Fried cabbage, black eyed peas, and  rice and gravy.....They were out of greens and mac and cheese...But what do you expect in the afternoon when everything is homemade? The pork chops were wonderful. The gravy is awesome and the place was full. Its good southern food at its best representation. I am from South Alabama so I should know....
I ordered 1 entree. It was just under $20 and took over 45 minutes to get. The staff was nice, but no one could be nice enough to make up for the time and price haha

We were heading into Vegas for a conference when my friend suggested we stop at EllaEm's as she claimed their fried chicken was the best ever!  She had been to EllaEm's on her last trip. So we did. There were 6 of us. We each ordered the Fried Chicken lunch plate and there honestly was enough food for 12 people. The food was amazing.  I had the fried chicke which is cooked fresh upon order, mashed potatoes and gravy and red beans and rice.  The service was great, the atmosphere hip, and everyone seemed to be happy to be there...both customers and staff.  Totally recommend this restaurant.

The portions were large.  I had the ox tail dinner and it was filling and fulfilling.   Totally satisfied with the succulent meat falling off the bone.  My wife had the catfish and it was equally delightful.  The prices were outrageously affordable.  This experience will  definitely get me back.  Our server Q took good care of us!
I visited this restaurant on a work trip. I loved the customer service. I ordered catfish, oxtails, greens, okra, black eyed peas. The food was delish! I will definitely return!

The food here is pretty good. I'm a true southern Gal so i can appreciate a gold home cooked meal that reminds me of mine or my Mom's.  The service was also pretty good the young lady had a great attitude and gave great customer service. I have No complaints I would visit again.

Let me first say that the customer service that we received here was top notch!  Jaz (I believe that was the lady's name) helped us and the other gentleman helping out were both amazing. They made sure that our drinks were full and checked up on us regularly.  They were also very accommodating considering that our 3 year old was knocked out and the husband had to carry her while he ate his meal.  I felt like they took an extra step to make sure we were happy and our needs were met.  Not only that, but they even gave each of us a to go cup of their lemonade, even though we only ordered one.  I thought that was pretty cool of them.

Now the only reason why I am giving them a 3 star rating is because I thought the food could have been better.  A lot of their dishes were on the salty side.  Like their collard greens, fried okra, and fried cabbage.  My mother in law thought the same thing which is unfortunate cause we were both excited to try their greens.  Not only that, but their chicken fried steak and shrimp were both hard, dry, and salty.  However, my son's grilled pork chops were pretty good.  They came out piping hot and juicy.  Oh and their muffins were delicious!  We kept asking for more muffins, they were that good.  

All in all, the experience itself was not bad.  Like I said, the customer service that we received was great, but the food could have been better.

A pile of well-seasoned catfish, solid greens and a mountain of mac and cheese for $7. Yeah, that'll do. Server was friendly and attentive. Not much more needs to be said -- if you're heading out Craig Road, great spot for lunch.

This was my first visit, fantastic service!  The food?  Eh.   

Service was good, but a little TOO on you to place your order.  I literally just walked into the door and was taking off my jacket and the young man was on me asking if I was ready to place my order.  Not my drink order, but my food order (I asked), and it was like that for the first 15-20 minutes we were there, every 3-4 minutes we were being asked to place our order.  I could understand if they were busy, but there were only 2 other people in there. My friend and I just wanted to chat for a minute before ordering, but we both felt like they were getting irritated, so we ordered.

I got the red snapper (1/2 the filet grilled, 1/2  fried), with mac n cheese and fried cabbage.  Now first, their cornbread was VERY good (maybe make them a little bigger?), loved the cornbread, they were just a little small.  Not worth the $.50 to get another one.  The fried cabbage was also VERY delicious, still had some crunch to it after being cooked and very flavorful with plenty of juice served with it.

Unfortunately, I had to send back the mac n cheese.   It looked like it was a few days old and had absolutely NO creaminess or taste to it.  It was also oily and badly separated, and stirring it didn't help.  I really hated to, but I sent it back and got the mashed potatoes with brown gravy, which were very, very good.  Potatoes were smooth, soft, hot, and well seasoned, as was the gravy.

The snapper, both grilled and fried, was WAY overcooked and very, very, very dry.  The flavors were very good, a good combo of spices, but I couldn't realky enjoy it because I had to take a bite of one of my sides along with the fish so I could swallow. There was no other other way to eat it, it was THAT dry.   I didn't send it back, though, bc I felt really bad about sending back the mac n cheese.  

I had a pleasant experience, it's a cute place where you can hold a conversation with someone without being drowned out by music.  They had GREAT music in the background, btw, classic R&B.  

But-for the pressure to order as soon as I got in, the service was wonderful...I think I ticked our server off by returning stuff, but he was still polite, and the young lady was VERY nice, I don't think the smile left her face!! LOL.  I'll give it another try and will obviously order something else.

*  Absolutely no offense is intended, but let me make some mac n cheese for the Executive Chef to taste.  Again I don't mean to offend, but more than 1 customer complained about this side and I'd love to try....
A must in Vegas. Family owned and operated the cooks do change and the quality suffers on those days. At drive from Southern Highlands to eat here and you should as well.
Truly enjoyed every thing from ambiance to service to price and most definitely the food.

On February 7, 2015 My business partners & I went to EllaEm's for dinner. We were told by Ms. Allyson they were closing & we'd have to place to go orders. Since we were hungry we said ok. Thankfully she had a change of heart & seated us. Between the four of us we ordered fried red snapper, oxtails, fried chicken, greens, yams, rice & gravy, potato salad, black eye peas and mac & cheese. The meal also came with corn muffins that were great for breakfast the next day :-) Everything was yummy!! We all left full, fat & satisfied. Thanks Allyson & Q for making our visit to Vegas all worth it. Great service. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in town.
!!!Great value!!! Rarely do I go home with leftovers, this trip I did.  Super clean dining area.... Many return visits are on the horizon :  )

So I've tried this place before when visiting about two years ago. The fact that I could vaguely remember my meal should have been a red flag! I LOVE well made soul food, this was lackluster at best.I'll start with the rice since it aggravated me the MOST because how do you fudge up plain white rice? It was so mushy and gummy  also the gravy needs so umph! The Oxtails were decent nice size no complaints there however I'm an oxtails rice and gravy tour of gal so the rice kind of fucked up the meal for me.  The Mac n cheese was boo boo it taste like had been sitting in a refrigerator for quite a while! Also it seems as though they use those deluxe box pasta GROSS. Please don't pass the garbage sprinkled with cheddar cheese as southern Mac! Last Item was the yams all I have is an eh for those. I'm writing this review to remind myself never to try this place again!

Visiting from California and had a craving for some soul food. Yelped my options and decided on this one. Best choice ever!!! Service was impeccable and everything I mean everything was just delectable. Not overly greasy or heavy but still packed with loads of flavor. This place will be an absolute go to every time I come to Vegas. Shout out to Q our server. :)

Went back and had excellent service as always!!! Love love love the food here!!! Definitely try the fried catfish or the shrimp and don't forget the Yams and rice and gravy. Yaaaaaasss! I seriously eat here every week and I'll be back soon!

OMG! I havent found this kind of "mama's" cookin since I left GA. Everything was PERFECT! BEST chicken fried steak ever, so crispy & juicy. Fried cat fish falls apart at 1st bite & batter stays on til last bite. Yams is like Thanksgiving heaven. Mashed potatoes are so smooth. Mac n cheese is loaded w cheese. Can't go wrong with fluffy rice & chicken gravy. LOVE LOVE LOVE it here! Very cute decor inside for sweet date night (especially rainy day) Service was friendly. Always coming back! :)

We called in our order and I picked it up...it was ready in 15 min. Piping hot. 

The friendliness of the staff and how clean the place looked gave me a great feeling about their food. 

We had the fried chicken and fried catfish meals. Each had awesome flavor but were a bit on the dry side. My faith was restored however in dipping each into the heavenly mash potatoes and gravy. Omg. I woke up at 2 am craving these potatoes! Our other sides were just as tasty...fried cabbage, Mac n cheese, rice, and these beautifully sweet yams. I'd go back for the sides alone. 

The meals also came with corn bread and we ordered a German choc cake and a sweet potato pie. These were also very good. 

If you are looking for some heavy hitting southern food this is the place to go. The hot sauce was also very good and I'm glad I have extras to use here at home!!
Food is very good catfish is awesome very delicious fry chicken is good I would come again and so very friendly staff
My Oxtails were amazing!!!! Along with my  yams, greens, fried cabbage and cornbread!!! The service was well inviting. The ambiance was relaxing and made you feel at home!!!

I finally made it here to try their Fried Chicken. I didn't feel like eating solo today so I just ordered it to go.

Fried Chicken - Dark (leg and thigh)
 includes 3 sides and cornbread
  -mac and cheese
  -mashed potatoes
  -fried cabbage

The chicken was fried perfectly. It was not greasy like the chicken you get from Popeyes. The sides were all very good. The cornbread was just ok.

There was also a sign on the register listing their lunch specials for $7 between 11am-3pm.

After seeing the 4 stars, my husband and I decided to try this place out. The service was horrible. The young man who helped was polite but there was a young girl working there and she needs some training. Overall the food was nothing special, I could of got the same thing or better at Popeyes. Even if the food was amazing, the service was too bad for me to go back. The girl server set a dirty plate from the table next to ours on our table because her hands were full! That should sum it up! Will not be back.

Authentic Soul Food. I had the fried chicken which was so crispy on the outside, very tasty and juicy on the inside. I wasn't a big fan of the dressing but the yams and sautéed cabbage were delicious. Nice desert selection but I didn't have any; I ended up taking the yams to go and had that for desert later. I will be back next time I am in the neighborhood.
This place is so down to earth. The hospitality is felt as soon as you walk thru the doors. I haven't even eating the food yet and I'm a fan.
The oxtails Meat Loaf fried cabbage potato salad and rice and gravy was the star of the show absolutely delicious the macaroni and cheese needs work

Okay so I usually never write bad reviews but this is strictly in reference to the "catfish" fillet, it is NOT catfish at all, it is Swai. I wouldn't complain but when I asked the waiter he agreed that it wasn't catfish. 

The sides I got were pretty good though; greens, candied yams, and Mac n cheese (could have been more creamy and less greasy) but all around were good. 

I highly suggest ordering something else.

Okay so while in Vegas a week ago, I finally got a chance to visit this place.  Honey and I loved it.  There was one young lady "I forgot her name" cute young girl curly hair I think it was Amesha or Anisha not sure.  She was so extremely sweet and gave great suggestions on what to try.  The prices are very reasonable and food was great, I had the Oxtails yummers, black eyed peas, potato salad and greens all was soooo delicious.  My honey had the fried chicken, double mac & cheese and mashed potatoes and gravy also very good.  The place felt like you were at home enjoying a good meal.  I will for sure be back.  The only reason it is short a star is because we took the desserts to go and when we had a chance to taste it which was peach cobbler for me I didn't like it at all and my honey got german chocolate cake and he said it was ok.

Omg!!! A friend and I visited this soul food spot on 12/1/12. The young lady that helped us was AWESOME!!! She took her time explaining the menu and was just the nicest young lady. The restaurant is small but cozy,great music was playing
I had the red snapper and was quite impressed!! My friend had the chitterlings dinner and she raved about how tasty they were. We found out the owner is from the Bay Area so that explained a lot since were also from those parts. All I can say is keep up the good work and if anyone is looking for a soul food spot THIS IS IT!!!!
Good Home cooking flavour. The vegetables were so good I may have to get just the vegetable plate on my next visit.

Nice decor & ambiance for a strip-mall restaurant, very surprising and welcome.  We were there on a quiet afternoon and were amazed at how fantastic the food is and the service was just incredible.  One of the gals there saw me picking food off my husband's plate and brought me a serving of the same thing, gratis.  

My southern hubby had the catfish plate and loved it, and we both loved the fried cabbage.  Not a southerner, I tried their cheeseburger - it was okay but there's a reason why this isn't a burger joint ;)

Next time (and there will definitely be a next time) I'll break down and try to deal with the southern obsession with frying everything ;)
The food was really good & hot when served . Serve was also great , I will definitely be back.

I live down the street and went here spontaneously without hearing anything about it. My first thought was wow this is pricey but then I got my food and the portions were HUGE. 
Cornbread was DELICIOUS 
Fried Chicken DELICIOUS
chicken fried steak DELICIOUS 
The only vice is really the service which isn't terrible but it's not that great either..
Perfect place to go if you want a hearty home cooked meal.

This place was quite the disappointment, ordered over the phone and was told that I must provide a credit card for phone orders, when I intended to pay cash upon arrival......so called back with card number, the lady made sure to ask If I'd actually had the card number, like I called back without having the proper information smdh.......tacky and a huge turn off, ordered my food was told it would be ready in 20mins........ waited for an hour, no apologies, neither was anything offered to me for my wait.......say some cobbler, something to show they were sorry about the wait.......the food was underwhelming, probably could get better soul food and service at Popeyes which is sad smdh, better yet could have cooked it at home myself.......one of my sides was wrong, fried chicken was disappointing, shrimp tasted as though it was cooked the day before.......never will order here again.......Ontop way over priced for what you get, three dinner meals came out to $51, simply a waste......will find a legit soul food restaurant to go to, or cook it myself at home.......Dont waste your time or money
Some of the best food ever! The fried chicken is amazing, perfectly cooked and don't get me started on the mashed potatoes....ummm delicious! We will be back everytime we come to Vegas!

The food here is great and decently priced. I totally would recommend this establishment. The staff is awesome and so friendly makes you feel so welcomed. The environment and feel of the place is so relaxing and easy. The lights are dim and the music is playing but not so loud to where you cannot talk with each other.
I had the country fried steak that was delicious. The portions of the sides are very generous . The mashed potatoes, fries, and mac and cheese were so tasty. My group all had different items on the menu and everyone was completely satisfied with the taste of the food. Everything about my experience here was great. I will be coming back!

So I Gotta Say, Me n My Wife Is A Regular Here.. Love The Food n The Service, But 2nite's Service Was Terrible.. Got In About 5:30pm and Waited, n Waited To Put In Our Order, But No One Came.. Waited About 30 Min. People Came After Us, Sat Down n Was Helped n Their Order Was Taken.. Kinda Irritated, So We Left.. But Oh Well, I Hope Our Service Will Be Better The Next Time..

Just a word of warning if you're planning on trying their bbq rib sandwich. It looked wonderful---big piece of meat sticking out of the bun. But beware, the ribs have the bones still in them! The ribs are very yummy but impossible to eat as a sandwich (I'm not quite sure why they serve it that way!). You have to remove the bun in order to eat it. If I had known that, I would have just ordered the bbq rib dinner and got 3 sides with it! With the "sandwich", you only get a choice of fries or potato salad.

This was our first time here and "Jaz" treated us like family. We already knew what we wanted to order so we placed our order. The food came out hot and delicious! Everyone at the table absolutely LOVED their food. We had the meatloaf, chicken and waffles, red snapper and a sample of the sides. It all tasted like grandma's home cooking! We will definitely be coming back.

Our sons loved the red Kool Aide, I had the sweet tea and our daughter had the lemonade. All the drinks were good. We also ordered a whole sweet potato pie for Thanksgiving. If you haven't been here you need to come. If we lived here I'd be here frequently.

Thank you Jaz for the wonderful customer service and for the love. Thank you chefs for the amazing food!

I came here with my extended family while we were out in Vegas for a softball tourney. The place was quite, cute and clean. We got seated right away. 

Ordered our food. A main dish and 3 sides, I got fried pork chops, greens, mac & cheese and red beans and rice. We had 6 people all together and the food came out quick. I was quite surprised that our food was out already. Everything I had was good. All my sides were good. Oh, yeah and they give you cornbread too. The cornbread was tasty too. I can't even say which side was my favorite, but I will say that the red beans and rice and greens were pretty damn tasty. Our server was friendly and our glasses were never empty. 

One thing I will say, is that their desserts, not all since I didn't try them all, but the Red Velvet cake and Lemon cake are not the ones. I think it was a box cake with vanilla frosting, not even the cream cheese frosting for the Red Velvet. Both cakes were a lil on the dry side.
 
Overall, it was a good experience and I would so go again if I was out wandering in Vegas.

Ok let me first start out by saying thank you Jazz for making our first time here a good one! Your smile and friendliness was exceptional. Second those cornbreads were to die for, I have had a few in my time and they have been dry but these ones were soft and moist. The fried chicken was yummy, the way they season it makes it so delicious and juicy. Make sure that when you go eat there you go hungry because it's a lot of food and you probably end up taking some left overs home, not that that's a bad idea. We will be back for those Ribs and Oxtail dishes.
Yum. Yum. Yum. So glad we stopped in. We were looking for a great fried chicken meal and we found it. Everything is homemade and delicious. We'll definitely be back.

So I've only been here once. This place is small, but nice. It's clean as well as roomy. The staff is pleasant. The food was pretty good, especially the sides. I've had better oxtails, but the sides were quite delicious. Overall, I can't complain. The experience was nice. But ultimately when it comes to soul food, I prefer down south cooking, or my family's good flavorful cooking.
The best soul food I had in Vegas by far so if your in Vegas you might want to make the effort to get some good soul food
Wonderful potato salad and catfish. Loved everything I've ever had here. The whole family loves it!

Im so done with supporting this place. 

The service is completely horrible to were Im feeling damn near disrespected. The staff mess up your food/order and istead  of apologizing and trying to fix it they play and insult you. I have never experienced being blamed for the restaurant mistakes until this place. 

The food is a 50/50 toss on consistency. The Mac and cheese for a soul food restaurant is actually under sub-par. The chicken, greens, and cabbage can be different tasting from day to day. 

I have placed orders 3 times each time my order has been forgotten to be placed. Ive been told to pick up in 30 mins. I get there and Im waiting for 1 hour 30mins and longer. The funny thing is you arent offered a refund, discount, drink, or nothing. Service and accountability go a long way with me. I once only ate here for Sunday's. Well time to find new places. 

And get a bigger space your kitchen is 5 times the size of the restaurant.

Went here with some friends around 1930..

I got the baked chicken, with Mac and cheese, yams, and collard greens!

I really like that they use turkey in there greens instead of pork, because I don't eat beef or pork!

The Mac and cheese was ok, and the yams were nice and sweet!!

The baked chicken was ok (wasn't as seasoned as I thought it would be) I'm not sure if it was because we arrived kind of late, but my food was luke warm..

Everyone else, enjoyed there food! If I am back in Vegas, I'll give this place another try, maybe I'll come earlier in the evening

EllaEm's was recommended to me a dear friend who comes every weekend for some grilled liver and onions, with a side of greens. 

We went on a Saturday so it was a bit busy but they managed to get us a table fast. 

The atmosphere is that of a fast food joint but more laid back. Black Art hang on the wall and family pictures. The staff is friendly. 

We had the chicken and the smothered pork chops. The portions are big and come with sides, like mashed potatoes and greens, plus a corn bread.

Great food...We had an older lady as our server she was scattered not organized at all and we chose a suitable table she instructed us to sit where she wanted us too...Again great food...Service eh.... Martha Carter of Fontana Ca.

Came to visit Vegas and wanted some soul food. Looked this place up and said let's try it eventhough it was a lillte out the way.....GLAD we did! We was promptly seated and ask if we wanted something to drink right away.... Funny cause 3 mins later another waitress asked did we want something to drink....They both were right on it!!!! Very nice and friendly! They keep checking on us.....after we ordered we received our food about 15-20 mins after.....food was fresh, tasty, and finger licking good!!!! It was southern good cooking! Food was excellent!  Glad we made the decision to go! Must try in Vegas!

Having a taste for my 2nd most favorite dessert I head over to Ella's for some peach cobbler. Upon entering I noticed the place was filled to the rim with people so I thought this should be good. After standing at the counter for what seemed like forever and listening to the chaos was not good, even noticed the lady at the counter ignore a phone call saying she was too busy to answer it, anyway I asked for a lg peach cobbler and was told I don't think we have any so now I'm annoyed but luckily another lady knew where it was and so she hands me 3 regular size containers which I guess equals 1 large.

I get home and dig in and I go wtf. Half of it was hard and the other half was doughy as if they took 2 screwed up pans and made 1 big screwed up pan. Since I didn't try any regular food I won't say I wouldn't try again but definitely will NEVER get peach cobbler again and hopefully if I ever visit again it won't be so crowded as it seems like they don't have the staff to handle large crowds

I am giving this place 3 STARS because of the professional friendly service. As far as the food is concern that I had ordered, the meat loaf was ok, but the mac & cheese needed the local pastor to come and lay hands on it for resurrection purposes...Shalom from the Bahamas

I got the smothered chicken with double mac and cheese and rice with some gravy. This is truly the meal that warms my heart. If you're looking for a great portion of food for a reasonable price. This is definitely the place for you.

No! The prices are too high for the food to taste like it did. It's not my cup of tea. They may need better cooks in the kitchen. My only used season salt and pepper for her food and it was fantastic. I think I tasted garlic in my gravy and I was not a happy camper. I gave the rest of my food to the dog and eventually to the trash. Everyone was rude except for a guy named Marquis I think... won't be back!

Soul food should always come in portions this generous! $16 seems like a bit much to spend on a smothered porkchop plate, but then you discover the plate includes three chops and three generous side portions- more than enough to share! Chops themselves come with your choice of chicken or beef gravy, but the overall flavors were just okay. After craving this dish for a week and driving half an hour, it just didn't quite hit the spot, unfortunately.

Sides selected were mac, greens, and cabbage- I'm not even a fan of cabbage but their version was flipping delicious with bits of ham and good crunch without too much oil. 
Too bad the other sides were so dismal- mac was a generous portion but super dry and the cheese was in large clumps as if my little sister were making it, while the greens were virtually flavorless aside from the heavy-handed dose of salt.
Cornbread was decent, kept in a warmer that perhaps over-steamed it, as they had a mushy texture that I did not care for.

I was hoping to find an alternative to M&M, but unfortunately this place was more miss than hit for me.

I went to EllaEm's today. I ordered the lunch portion of the baked chicken with mac n cheese and yams. First, the chicken was under cooked. Second, the yams were 99% sugar. They were so sweet to the point I couldn't enjoy them. I love yams so you can image how disappointed I was. 
People cautioned me not to go there but I believe in trying things for yourself. With that said, I will not be back to EllaEm's.
Soon as my family and I walked in we felt at home. Excellent customer service. I will definitely make this a "go to" place when I come and visit LV.  Food was excellent!!!!!!!

FOOD- awesome awesome awesome!!!! ive only had the OX Tail and the waffles/chicken and it was absolutely delicious.

SERVICE- AWESOME. The people are friendly, they ask how everything is doing, and they are very respectful. 

Atmosphere- Great. 

Price- The OX tail is pricey, but well worth it. 

Very well could be the best Soul Food in las vegas... as it was rewarded for 2 years. I dont like N. Las Vegas to begin with but i'm glad we at least have this on our side of town.

Sundays are packed as the local community has started coming in.  I found the portions to be pretty good myself (especially for the three sides); but in a buffet town I could see where some people may find them small.

You can get many of the dishes fried or grilled (I've had the catfish fried and the red snapper grilled -- both good.)  I have to agree with Mrs. P though, the liver and onions (with gravy of course) were really good.

Great find in North Las Vegas!  Highly recommended.

On the positive side. the original proprietor and I share the same birthday. The staff was pleasant. 

I wanted this place to be good, I really did. It was ok. Not good, not bad. The greens were bland. The barbecue was nothing write home about and lacked meat on the bones. The cornbread was dry. The catfish wasn't flavorful. The food, overall was greasy in a bad way.

I did enjoy the black-eyed peas.

I'm sorry, just had much better.

Came on Father's Day to check out the menu items as I was looking for some soul food. I had the catfish, Mac cheese, greens, and mashed potatoes. The catfish was great, the mashed potatoes were delicious. I had the chicken gravy on my mashed potatoes. The Mac cheese was very disappointing as were the greens. The greens had too much of the stems left on them and the Mac cheese was dry and no cheese flavor. The server was really nice but unfortunately the service was extremely slow. They should also greet guest when they come in as we were unsure if we should stand in line and place the order for here or if we should sit and wait for the server. The servers kept passing us by while we sat so my daughter stood in line and then asked if we had to give the order and then sit down. Other guest were confused as well. I will still come again but may just have my order to go.

Love!! Love! Love! the food here. We are from Memphis and this place reminds us of home! The fried chicken and catfish are our go-tos! ANY side you order will not disappoint! The yams melt in your mouth! The greens are seasoned to perfection! The Mac and cheese is yummy!! We really need to try some other things on the menu, but we just love these so much! 
The service is also great! We are huge fans of EllaEms!!

I had the oxtails (which were excellent) and mac & cheese,  potato salad,  & black eye peas as sides.  Lysa ordered the fried chicken with greens, mac & cheese,  and steamed vegetables as sides.   The food was very well prepared and quite tasty.   No doubt we will be making regular visits here.  The only reason why I didn't give 5 stars is because of the less than stellar service that we got from the young man.  First of all, he didn't know the menu.   He tried hard enough but needs help.  We ordered the German chocolate cake for dessert and he said that we had to pay for it before he will serve it.  WHAT?!
In spite of that,  don't be surprised if you see us there.   Over and over again.

Ok - second time and I am NOT impressed. Food was mediocre - preheating up cornbread, peach cobbler not cool- nor is telling people that some of the desserts are homemade- but I see the cheesecake factory box. I'm sure what some of the other yelper's  stated are valid and true facts as well. Out of two wait staff -only one is friendly- which is not good- nor is messing up my  order twice. Would I come back here-Nope

Soooooo Good!!!! 

I had the catfish, greens, yams, mac n' cheese and corn bread. First of all the food was very hot when served. I love that! I hate getting a cold plate of food. The catfish was cooked so Right, not all greasy but fried perfectly. The greens and yams for SOOOOO delicious. The corn was the perfect amount of sweet, just Delicious and they serve it with room temp butter, not cold butter. Cold butter with bread doesn't make sense to me. The mac n cheese was just okay to me but only because I've had some phenomenal mac n cheese homemade. It was clean, the staff was courteous and helpful. 

If you are in Vegas take the detour off the strip and hit this place up. They were named the best soul food restaurant in the Las Vegas area but I've been to several places in L.A. and they have been the best so far. 

YUMMMMMYYY!

Ellaem's is outstanding and has geniue Southern Soul Food.  I had the fried chicken with the white meal smoothered in chicken gravy and it was fantastic!  The fried chicken was lightly battered, very moist and tender.  I had the fried cabbage, potato salad and the rice and beans as my sides and the portions were very generous and delicious.  

The staff is very helpful and friendly.  Kim was one of our servers and she is outstanding with a very cheerful personality.

I would highly recommend Ellaem's and we are certainly going to be go back on a regular basis.
Blown away. Hidden away in a shopping complex,but the best fried chicken & macaroni. Fresh food,  fast friendly service, and nice atmosphere.

I ordered pork chops over rice with collards, sweet potatoes. I thought the meal was just average. No wow factor at all. Not particularly savory or even well seasoned. A bit disappointed. I probably will not return.

There aren't very many places to get soul food in Vegas, so this was a pleasant surprise. It appears to be a family run restaurant and there's not too many staff members here. There was one waitress/hostess here when I came for lunch, so the service was a little slow but expected. 

I got the $7 lunch special that comes with an entree choice, two sides, and cornbread. I had the fried chicken, which was decent but not great. I had a drumstick that was cooked to perfection, but a breast piece that was overly salty. Not sure why that was. I also got a chance to try the catfish that my coworker ordered and I would get that if I were to come back. Perfectly crisp and flavorful.

Among the sides I tried, the cabbage and yams were good, while the mac and cheese and collared green were just alright.

The cornbread was very moist with good texture as well.

If there were a 0.5 star rating, I would probably give EllaEm's a 3.5 overall. There are hits or misses on the menu. Also, some extra staff members to help with the service would be beneficial.

This place was phenomenal, simple menu, great service, great portions and the food was great. Just didn't care for the shrimp. We came during regular hours and for each person the food was about $15 for 3 sides and a entre. I had the catfish, yams, Mac N cheese, and fried okra very good but also had their peach cobbler and that failed miserably. The breading didn't taste good at all, the texture was gross and bland.

Fried Pork Chop lunch was fanstastic as usual!  Enjoyed it with Black-Eyed Peas, Greens and Cornbread of course.  We love everything on the menu to include Snapper, Catfish, Fried Chicken, Yams, Mac & Cheese... Peach Cobbler!  Service is always great whether it's me and the gang from the office at lunch or our family for dinner.  Fortunately, we live close but I would drive cross town for EllaEm's!

The best soul food I have had in a LONG time. I have lived in the South and was raised Southern..This reminds me of my Grandma's good for the soul cooking with a modern day twist. This will be my spot everytime I visit Vegas!!!

My second time visiting this place and again, a great experience. Very nice small place located in a strip mall in North Las Vegas. Somewhat unassuming and far from a 'hole in the wall'. 

I stopped in for lunch with a couple of coworkers who told me to yelp us a place. The service was awesome just like it was last time. The food is made to order so it comes out absolutely piping hot. With that said, you will wait a few extra minutes for the freshness. 

The service was great. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. We went in after the lunch hours so it was not very busy. They have about a dozen different lunch specials right at $10 or so. 

I went with the fried chicken and it was very good. If I'm being completely honest, not the best fried chicken I've ever tasted but it was still very very good. And it being so fresh is a definite added bonus. The candied yams are phenomenal. The yams are few in number so I was glad it had 2 sides. I also got the collard greens and they were very tasty.

They give you a complimentary piece of cornbread as an appetizer and it's super tasty as well. 

If you haven't been- go here. It's voted the best soul food in the valley and you'll see why.

I really enjoyed my food here. My shrimp fried fresh and hot and the grease was clean. Their cabbage is very tasty and I would definitely order it again. The yams were yummy, and the homemade lemonade was good really sweet though, but extra ice will make it perfect. My group really enjoyed the fried chicken also. Also, the waitress there name Anisha is a great waitress and definitely worthy of a big tip.
This is probably my favorite Soul food restaurant in Vegas. I've had a number of items on the menu and they have all been very flavorful and tasty.

Been wanting to try this place for a while so today while in the area the Mrs. and I went in.  First thing I noticed was the aroma of the place.  It wasn't pleasant.  The whole time I was there I was thinking that we shouldn't gotten our food to go.  However, that being said, it was the only downfall to this establishment.  But a SERIOUS downfall.  

Service was hands down good.  The waitress was very friendly and checked up on us plenty but not too much.

We both ordered Fried Chicken white meat and it was tender and juicy.  Side dishes that I tried are: collard greens- fantastic.  red beans and rice- another great side.  fried okra- Good batter but after the small bowl of them i was oiled out. 

I tried the mash potatoes and chicken gravy the Mrs. had and it was really good.  So was her potato salad and mac & cheese.  

We will order here again but it will be TO GO due to the smell of the place.  That is the only reason I took one star off.

A really nice soul food place. A lot of other soul food restaurants in Las Vegas have very cramped dining rooms (Gritz, Seven Seas) but this place is very spacious, clean and the walls are covered with art, family photos and posters of Black heroes like Martin Luther King Jr and President Obama.

I want to give this place three stars. The food was pre-made and reheated in a microwave, but it was still good. Still, it's always disappointing to have your plate of soulfood goodness put down in front of you and your mac and cheese is still holding the same shape as the container it was stored in.

I'm giving them four stars because of the ambiance and their stellar service. Our waiter appeared to be working the place by himself but he was attentive, very polite and knowledgeable about the menu. He offered a discount if we gave a great Yelp review, so think of that when you look at other reviews.

One dining partner ordered the veggie plate, which is basically cornbread and your choice of three sides. One of her three sides chosen was fried cabbage and our waiter stated it's made with turkey bacon (there is a sign up that says their food is made w/turkey instead of pork when possible). She was disappointed but I think its great that they're at least trying to cut back on sodium and fat by using healthier alternatives.

2nd dining partner had the meatloaf which included two sides. 3rd dining partner had  the oxtails smothered in gravy that were so delicious he threatened violence if we dared to touch his plate when he went outside to take a phone call.

I had the spicy chicken sandwich with a side of mac and cheese. I always order mac and cheese at any soul food place I go to; it's not a real soul food restaurant unless you have bomb-ass mac and cheese. EllaEm's was good, but nothing I'd go out of my way to eat again. Since it was reheated, it wasn't melty and gooey, but it wasn't bad either. The chicken was spicy, crunchy and a nice piece of meat, but the only thing on my bread was tomato and lettuce. No sauce, no nothing, not even mayo. I hope I'm not the only one who thinks that's odd.

I'm not itching to go back, but this place is definitely worth a second try.
Awesome place to eat! Our waitress was the BEST! I love the Soul in this Soul food restaurant!

This little gem is about 20 minutes from the strip and well worth the trip.  Great customer service and the food was delicious.  Everything came out piping hot and tasted great!  I had the chicken and waffles, some of the best I've had.
EllaEm's is a great to eat!!! The people are very nice and helpful. The food is wonderful!!!! I will definitely eat there again and again!!!

Introduced to this place on Monday this week, been here everyday since for lunch.  Best Catfish and Meatloaf ive ever had.  After having a meal here my belly feels so warm and satisfied.. Makes a crappy day amazing!! Will be back here very often.

The food is so good! Everything I had I enjoyed! Just like the menu says, "Food that makes you feel good to your Soul!". I will definitely go back at least twice a month. Tonite I had the Catfish, Mac & Cheese that tastes like my grandmothers homemade, Collard Greens, Fried Cabbage and Corn Bread. Next time I'll most likely get the Oxtails. I tried my mother-in-laws and they were so good as well! Definitely the Best Soul Food I've had in Las Vegas!

Oh, this place feels like my grannies house on a Sunday afternoon. Everything is made with such care and it's literally the most authentic soul food/southern cooking in Vegas. So glad I found them, they taste like home.

My friend and I have been wanting to try this place for awhile now. The food was pretty good but a word to the wise--don't come here if you're in any sort of hurry. It took us over 45 minutes to get our food AFTER we ordered. 


We showed up a few minutes after they opened at 11:00am. The service was a little bit slow. It that's ok--my friend and I hadn't seen each other for a few weeks so we were busy catching up. We both decided on their lunch special--you get your main dish and then two sides. My friend had the fried catfish with mac and cheese and potato salad. Lemme tell you--that potato salad may be the best one I've ever had!  I chose the meatloaf with mac and cheese and fried cabbage.  With the meatloaf you have the choice of having it with gravy or a tomato sauce. Per the servers recommendation, I had mine with the tomato sauce. It wasn't bad...but I think I would have liked the gravy better. The mac and cheese...I had such high hopes for it and it definitely fell short. There wasn't much taste it at all.  The fried cabbage was dang tasty though--probably my favorite part of the meal. 

All in all, it wasn't a bad experience.  I'd go back again but it's not a place I'm going to be like "omg...we have to go here again, again and again".

Stopped in for carry out. 
Food:   Delicious 
Service:    Awesome 
Price:   Very Reasonable

WILL BE BACK !!

I loved the mashed potatoes !!

This was our second time here. Food was delicious as usual. I had the snapper with potato salad, greens and red beans. My husband had the chittlerlings with yams, greens and macaroni.  Jazz was our server, she's amazing. She made our experience even better. We will definitely be back!!
Out of everything we had the only things we enjoyed we're the catfish and corn bread. Everything else was not satisfying.

Ok. I see you. This place exceeded expectations. Service was right on point. They give u cornbread biscuits soon as u sit down. Good coffee. Catfish n yams n mashed potatoes was fire (awesome). I'll be back!!!
First time trying soul food & it was better than expected! Definitely a place I'd go back to! Although one of the servers was a bit rude when we asked for refills or for service in general

Here again! The food, the food, the food was so good. My mamma's house would take second place, if I they didn't have such good service with a smile, which doesn't happen at my momma house. I enjoy the catfish with yams, collard greens, and rice as the lunch special. I got it quick and before I expected. Enjoy that place while in Las Vegas!

Had the Groupon.. yay! Very glad, because I had never heard of this place. 

So many people claim that they're cooking up soul food, however this place actually nails it. I felt as though I was eating at my aunt's house.

I order catfish with potato salad and I also had peach cobbler. Catfish was great. Potato salad was amazing! Uncommon for me to say this, because I have yet to taste decent store bought/restaurant potato salad.

I will say stay away from the cobbler. Awful! 

The inside is really clean and fun. Great for kids. Amazing staff!
When we want some down home cooked southern meals....this is the only spot we go to.  I hghly recommend the oxtails and mac and chhese!!!

The 3 pieces of filet catfish were not worth 9.16. Seasoning alright. The mini cornbread muffin was good and moist.  Dimly lit. The cashier was nice and friendly(which deserved and got a tip). The tables were customers are eating are to close to the counter/cashierits amazing how prices have gone up and the portion size have been drastically reduced.  Tried this due to hype.

Delicious food and service. Our waiter was attentive and helpful. The food was well-prepared, fresh and delicious. The menu offers quite the variety, so it was difficult to choose an entrée.  We all selected something different and tried one another's food. It was all tasty! Will definitely return.

It's always best to call in your order because it takes can take a while. But it is always worth the wait. 

This is my go to when I dont feel like cooking but I want my family to have a home cooked meal.

Soul food at its best!! My cousin told us to come here. It was perfect for our last day in Vegas! Our server amanda was the best nice and friendly. I had the red snapper,fried okra,and mac and cheese! Everything was seasoned well. Omg the collord greens were ro die for!! Cant wait to go back to Vegas just to come here and eat!!!

Everytime I step foot in Vegas I always come here they have the best Soul Food!!!! So don't waste your time at other soul food places there garbage I Was there Thursday & Friday and had the fried Red Snapper with Collard Greens, Black eye peas, Macaroni Cheese, and  the bomb corn bread Everything was excellent!!!!!* The only thing the ##GRAVY## was way to ##SALTY## so somebody in the kitchen is to heavy handed with the salt back there!!!! Other than that well done  Very clean and waitress nice, friendly and  professional....

Amazing food and a chill atmosphere. The staff is super nice too! If you decide to come make sure you get the fried catfish! Comes with 3 sides too! Collard greens and the candied yams are THE BOMB! :)

Wonderful food! So yummy. For southern fried food this is the place. 
If you're in the mood for collard greens, fried okra, fried chicken, meatloaf or cornbread this is the place

Food= absolutely delicious. 
Fried catfish was so yummy. 
Home made mashed potatoes were out of this world w/ chicken gravy was an added bonus. Yams were cooked perfectly yummy 
I was happy to find out the black eyed peas were amazing. One of the reasons I came in the first place
