Customer service= ehh. My gf asked for gravy on her pork chops and no gravy on her mashed potatoes. Her plate came out with neither then she re brought out the plate and there was gravy on both lol I had to ask her to bring out the black eyed peas because apparently she had forgotten.
Thanks Loretta for the great service. Had the smothered chicken fried cabbage collard greens yams, food was great will be back.

I came here a few times a month a year ago when I lived on this side of town. It was so good! I would always get fried chicken, rice n gravy, and mashed potatoes. I came back a few months ago I went and the food wasn't the same. Not sure if they changed recipes or the cooks weren't trained properly, but I was so disappointed.

My husband and i are regulars, and eat there every Friday Night. The food is out of this world tasty, and for those who don't turn their noses up, the liver and onions are superb. No, they don't cook it like shoe leather. The collard greens are beautifully sesoned, not overcooked. The fried chicken is divine, and the black eyed peas are seasoned so well. If you want great southern food, EllaEm's can't be beat!

IT'S ALL ABOUT THE CATFISH! 
Atmosphere: small, cozy, fun music and conversation just fill this space with a jovial feeling. 

Service: cheerful, friendly, and attentive. Forgot my salad until I was already eating my meal. Really should have comped it at that point. I didn't eat it. 

Food: FRIED CATFISH! This is what I came for and I was not disappointed. Perhaps the BEST catfish I've ever eaten. I will crave this regularly. The mashed potatoes were just alright, I didn't even eat them. The mac n cheese was very good. I'll be having that again. The salad was forgotten and by the time it arrived I wasn't in the mood but they used what tasted like bottled hidden valley ranch and I really prefer the freshly made stuff. The sweet tea wasn't sweet enough. I know! I was shocked too. 

Price: a little high. I wish I could just buy the catfish and none of the sides. But I'll pay it to get that catfish so. ...

Best corn bread in town! You only get a small serving though. I always want so much more. I've had the fried catfish and the meatloaf here. Personally, I thought the meatloaf was better, but the catfish was pretty good. The sides are also very tasty. I would highly recommend the black-eyed peas and the baked beans.

If you want soul food in Vegas this is the place to go. I usually get the fried catfish but everything is good. The ribs fall right off the bone. It's always a challenge picking out sides. The mac n cheese, fried okra, mashed potatoes and greens are all fantastic. The only thing I can say negatively is that sometimes it gets hot in the restaurant but it's worth it despite the heat.

It's something in the food and the environment that gives it all the soul. Jaz is the truth. A great waitress with a great personality and beautiful welcoming smile. Plus I appreciate that they all remember you. Starts feeling like you pulling up to yo mama house to get a plate. And did I tell you the food is off the chain. #loyalcustomer

The cornbread...OMG..it tastes like cake.  The service was excellent, the food was awesomely good. I had oxtails, Mac n cheese, yams, and rice no gravy.  I haven't had a good soul food meal like that since I last cooked...lol...I very rarely cook.  Try it and I'm certain you will enjoy it like I did.

The ambiance is cute, and a little small if you choose to dine in. I've ordered from here twice and I'd have to say the food is mediocre. Definitely not what you could get home cooked, but it satisfies. It's hard to find authentic souls food that makes you want to slap your momma! If you are craving soul food, then this would be its "fast-food" equivalent. It's all cooked fresh, you can see the cooks through the little window to the back, but the taste is pretty generic.

My husband and I were meeting family here. We are from out of town and they live there,but have never been there. Ok, that is the set up. I ordered the snapper dinner and my family ordered the steak dinner and the fried chicken dinner. The group was not new to soul food so we asked some ??'s.1st, don't order sweet tea! Each dinner comes with 3 sides. I noticed one family member did not eat the fried okra or the mixed veggies. the other family member skarfed her fried chicken. My snapper was fresh! and large! Three pieces was one larger fillet!
The place was clean. We did not have  to walk thru the kitchen to get to the bathrooms. The house was clean and nice.  Thank you Ellaem's! We enjoyed our time with you.

I guess the thing that messes things up for ElllaEm's is that I grew up on soul food in L.A. and it's simply better than any I've had in LV....M & Ms, Roscoe's Chicken N Waffles, Aunt Kizzy's Back Porch, Harold & Belles...you hear me knockin'?

Went with the chicken  and waffles and they were ok.  The chicken needs more seasoning and there needs to be a few more pieces on the plate. The waffle needs to be pumped up some because they are a bit on the thin side and not too flavorful. I would recommend there be a host/ hostess  posted  at the entrance because when you walk in you don't know what to do. Do I wait  for a server or do I just pick my own seat?  Service needs to be faster as well, we waited far too long  for the amount of food we ordered. 

Now, me and my out of town guests  were dead set on trying the peach cobbler but they said they ran out. I love cobbler so I tried again on Sunday and they ran out again. Still have not tried the cobbler.

I think EllaEm's excels at their sides. The yams are some of the best anywhere. The collard greens are excellent and the fried cabbage is pure perfection. However,  the mac n cheese was just ok. 

Prices are reasonable  and parking is really good. There are several other good eateries within this shopping center as well. For first timers I recommend ordering the pork chops, collard greens, yams and the cobbler......if you can find it.

Yum yum YUM!!!!! My top soul food restaurant by far!  It's hard to find good catfish in Vegas, but theirs is always fresh tasting, cooked perfectly, and just down right delicious! 

I will admit that's sometimes the sides aren't consistent, but I've had more good days than bad. 

Mac n cheese, yams, greens, and red beans n rice are my top picks! 

Definitely worth a visit!!!

This place was pretty good and the waitress was really nice to us. She brought my toddler some extra corn bread because that's the only thing he would eat lol! I ordered the fried pork chops (pretty good), collard greens (delish), fried cabbage (blah), and mac & cheese (amazing). My husband had fried chicken and waffles and he loved it. The portions were huge. My only complaint was the restaurant wasn't very nice and the bathrooms needed TLC. I think we will order take out from now on but it was very good soul food.

5 stars! I love EllaEm's soul food! I have been here multiple times because of their chicken and waffles. The chicken and waffles portion is pretty big. It comes with a big waffle and 3 chicken wiings/leg. It can feed the both of us. Sometimes we will just add a few sides and an extra waffle to make us extra full. I admire how they keep their food nice and fresh. Everything that we have tried is always so delicious. Their mac and cheese isn't too salty and has the right amount of seasoning and cheese. Their mash potatoes with brown gravy is delicious too. It always tastes fresh like they just whipped some up just for you and your plate of food. Their potato salad is yummy! It has that little bit of sweetness and tartness from the mustard, I would love to take some on a picnic. Ha! Their cornbread always comes out warm with a bunch of butter. My fiance loves their cornbread, I don't blame him. It has the crunchy outer texture and the inside is soft and warm. Yummm. Just thinking about their food is making my mouth water! I believe everything they make, they make with love which is why I gave them 5 stars. Prices are worth it too. 

I love the inside of the restaurant too. They kept it nice and simple and kind of true to the type of food they make. Nothing is too fancy, you can comfortably eat and feel cozy. The walls have posters and they have pictures of their family members and I love it. The servers also remember who you are if you eat there twice within a week. Haha. I don't regret it. I absolutely love EllaEm's!  Oh! They also do trays of food which is nice... So maybe one Thanksgiving I won't make any food, but I'll order all my food from here!

I would have really, really LOVED to give EllaEm's five stars. Here's why I can't.
We went last night for my grandmother's 79th birthday. I called ahead to let them know that a party of 8 would arrive at 6pm because I'd done some recon and saw it was a small place.
We arrived on time, we're seated and greeted on entry. Our waitress took our drink orders and returned promptly.
Here's when it goes south.
It took 53 MINUTES from the time we ordered for any food to come out. Then they served 4 of our party.
The rest of us had to wait another 28 MINUTES for our orders. By the time they brought our food, everyone else (who were starving after waiting almost an hour to eat) were almost done. 
I knew based on the reviews that this place was a diceroll. Unfortunately on such an important occasion I crapped out. I was mad because I was the one that suggested this place.
The food was AIIGHT but not bomb. The best thing about my meal (I ordered fried chicken, greens, and potato salad) was the potato salad. 
Disappointed in so many ways because I live right around the corner and this could've been my family's soul food spot, but we will not be coming back, ever.

Great atmosphere, and even better food! Cornbread was sweet and warm.   Catfish was lightly breaded and delicious. Sides (greens & Mac) were also very good. So glad that I stumbled across this gem! I understand why they have multiple best of Las Vegas awards!!

Was in Las Vegas for a short while and never had soul food or could find any good while there. Until my friend who lives here suggested this place. And to my surprise I loved it the delicious fried chicken, greens, mac and cheese almost as good as my home cooking :o) And lets not forget the red velvet cake was delicious as well. If you haven't tried this little treasure of a place I highly suggest it, I'll try it again when I'm in a couple of months to make sure it wasn't just a fluke. And also to try something different on the menu, oh and to the person who felt they were forced to order a burger please the pleasure of going out to eat is getting what you want. Never let a cook or anyone persuade you other wise. Because after all you're paying the bill, so you could have easily left if they weren't fufilling your request for what you wanted. I patronize businesses that are there to please the customer, if that's not the purpose then why are they in business. Give them another try, and next time order what you want because I will. A satisfied customer, see you next time Vegas :o)

Very, VERY disappointed! This is my third/fourth time here and this has been the worst of all time. I called in my order because I don't like to wait. I was told it would be ready in 30 minutes. I left my house exactly 30 minutes after placing the order. The place is only about 5 minutes from my house so you would think once I arrive the food would be ready right? Ummmm no!! The person I normally deal with is not there. There is a guy that looks like they hired him directly off the street working at the register. I paid for my food and was told that one of the meals was just getting prepared, smh. I run next door to grab some items and come back and my food has been given to someone else. I am LIVID! The food is great but the customer service SUCKS! I'm just leaving after being there since 8pm! RIDICULOUS!! Until they get better customer service stay far away from this establishment!!! What restaurant do you know that doesn't have a manager on site? They have to call him on the phone and he sounds like he is 6th grade educated!!! I'm sooooo done right now!!
First time here. I had the oxtails. Food was good. Great atmosphere. Friendly staff. No complaints. Definitely will be back to try the chicken and waffles.

ate there 4 days ago. best soul food in las vegas.the oxtails were the best we ever had.the sides were unbelieveable! fried okra,red beans and rice,yams,black eyed peas and rice and gravy the best ever.when you sit down to order they bring you warm cornbread best we ever had.my wife not a fan of but she loved this.

Had the Fried Catfish, (very good), Mashed Potatoes with brown gravy,(good) collared greens,(not good) my co-worker got the grilled Red Snapper,(very good) mac and cheese(not good) and collared greens( she liked). I thought the service was good, portion size good and the restaurant was clean and well decorated.

Came in from The Bay Area and heard this is The Best Soul Food in Las Vegas I was not disappointed, everything was Really good, love that they use Turkey instead of Pork in their greens and the cabbage. The muffins were so yummy , ate more than I intended.

First time going in and it definitely won't be my last. Beautiful ambience with neo soul music and r&b. Perfect chill music to enjoy dinner. Reminiscent of grandmas house. Being from Florida, I have been waiting for a genuine soul food restaurant and this is it. Dressing not stuffing, yams not sweet potato, baked macaroni and cheese not Mac and cheese. Great food. Cabbage was a little salty but other than that no complaints.
Food was awesome as usual!!! Could not finish it, but took it to my hotel.  It was so good had it the next day.  I think this a great place to get a home cooked meal when you are traveling.

I ate here 3 times. All times the food was good but extremely greasy. We tried the Ox tails, catfish and pork chops. The sides were extremely good greens, red beans and rice. Staff was friendly and attentive.

My first time in Las Vegas and I couldn't have had a better experience! What makes an awesome adventure is the food you eat on the way and Ella Em's Soulfood is the #1 place to go to if you want amazing food without the Las Vegas crowd. I got the yams with fried chicken and collard greens which was out of this world! Jazzland, our waitress, had so much patience with everyone and has such a great personality which made it that much better. Timothy, our other waiter, made sure we had everything we needed while cleaning and tending to other tables with Jazzland. Their work ethic is very impressive and the food is to die for. Definitely coming back whenever I'm in Vegas again.

I love finding little hidden family owned restaurants because you know they put their heart and soul onto every place... and they definitely heavily ladled on the soul!
Now down to the food:
-catfish filets: They were flaky and moist with the right amount of breading and crispiness on the outside. Not too oily, but still sinfully good
-The country fried steak was just downright comfort on a plate. Very rich- I would recommend getting the chicken gravy over the brown gravy. I think the chicken gravy just goes better. 
-Yams- amazing!! I would highly recommend this side. It's sweet almost like a sweet potato pie filling. I liked it because it almost served as a palate cleanser at the end of my meal & as dessert too! 
I will definitely be back to try the other dishes that caught my eye: oxtail, fried chicken, more catfish mmm they will need a wheel barrel to roll me away

Ok, first I must say I was a bit turned off by the girls working behind the counter. They had a tendency to play with their hair and not once thought about washing or sanitizing their hands. I brought it to their attention. They weren't happy with me but oh well. 
Then a change of Shift and the scenario was completely different. 
First let me say Thank You Ramon. You made our stay fabulous. When Ramon was working he sanitized the silverware. Whenever he worked with someone's food he always had gloves on and was extremely pleasant. Whenever he handled money he always sanitized afterwards. I am impressed. 
The restaurant is extremely clean, a good find no doubt. 
The food brought back memories I cherish if being back in Greensboro North Carolina at my Aunt Sadie's home at dinner time. 
Everything that came to us was flavorful and absolutely delicious. Catfish and fried chicken, crispy and not greasy, an awesome cook. Cabbage cooked with bacon wow, red beans and rice right out of the south. 
Out of all the things that make me mad is the fact that I haven't found it before today. 
Be Warned I will be back.

When you think of Soul Food, Catfish comes to mind. No, not the stupid reality show on tv but the real actual fish. Here they do have it with your choice of it fried or grilled. They also have Chicken n Waffles. I took my 12 year old son with me to check this place out. We did ended up getting the Catfish and the Chicken n Waffles.

The Chicken n Waffles were pretty good. You get 3 nice sized chicken wings, a waffle, and eggs any style you want. The chicken was crispy and slight breading to it. The waffle was just ok. I was expecting to be at least a little more crispy than it appeared. The eggs we got scrambled. Nothing special to note there.

The Grilled Cajun Catfish was good as well. Came with your choice of 3 sides. I picked Mashed Potatoes with Beef Gravy, Mac n Cheese, and Mixed Veggies. This is where I got really disappointed. The Catfish was decent but all the sides tasted a bit bland and was lukewarm. The veggies were definitely not fresh because it was partially soggy, it looked lifeless, and was chewy when I took a bite. The Mac n Cheese tasted like what I make my kids at home with the instant microwave stuff. It's not fancy but it is good enough for them. Here at a restaurant that is unacceptable. Last but not least, the Mashed Potatoes were a bit dry. Maybe they didn't put enough water or milk in the mix before putting it in the microwave?

As for service, they are a bit slow here. We came in at 6:45 pm on a Tuesday night. There were only two other tables occupied at the time. We got our food I would say about 15 minutes later. After about 5 minutes both our drinks were empty. Another 5 minutes later I had to ask for a refill on both our drinks. Rule of thumb, if you have to ask for refills after so much time has passed, that is not good service. 

In closing, I would stick to ordering the Chicken n Waffles and Catfish. Stay away from the sides, well at least what I ordered. To be fair I cant assume everything was nuked. I also would like to try other items so I can give them the benefit of the doubt especially if it warrants updating this review. Until then, its 2 stars for me.

The food looked much better online than it did in my togo box. At first glance I thought the Mac and  Cheese was gonna be nasty, but it wasn't as bad as it looked, but not what I expected from a soul food spot. I ordered the catfish lunch special. The fish was really good. The cornbread muffin was really good. I was not impressed with the yams either. I ordered over the phone and had to give my card info before they would start the food...... Anyways I think this place is over priced, but there were a lot of people in the restaurant. I'll give it another try before I am completely done.
Now this place here is the best Soul Food place in the State of Nevada. When family and friends come to town this is where I go.

The food here is fantastic! I am from NC so soul food is in my blood (and on my hips!). You get a ton of food, no way anyone can handle an entree and the 3 sides in one sitting. The ox tails were tender and seasoned well; yams were excellent, collard greens were amazing; and the mac and cheese was tasty, although the cheese/eggs were a little curdled. We will definitely visit there a lot to get our soul food fix!
Oxtail is bomb!!!! I love this place so much. I come here whenever I want oxtail.... I like the atmosphere too. Seriously some really good soul food!!

Hands down best soul food joint I've had yet. There are still a couple I haven't tried in Vegas. So as of now this place takes the lead!

They are voted "Best soul food restaurant in Las Vegas" and they do live up to that reputation. When you first walk in, it's kind of small but had a homey comfy feel. The ladies there were very warm and welcoming. Advising us we can take a seat where ever we feel comfortable. Service was excellent. Someone came and got our drinks and order real quick.

I ordered the smothered chicken, white meat. It comes with 3 sides & also cornbread. I got -- mashed potatoes, greens, & Mac n cheese. And oh my goodness. The mashed potatoes were one of the best I ever had. Idk what they put in it but it was so creamy and the gravy accented the mashed potatoes just right. The greens were pretty alright, nothing special about them though. Mac n cheese was da bomb! It had just the right amount of cheesiness. Now let me tell you about the chicken! The chicken was perfection. Even tho it was fried, it wasn't dry, it was so moist! I do recommend getting the white meat instead of dark because it does make a difference on the taste. 

The beau got the chicken and waffles. It doesn't come with sides but it does come with 3 chicken wings, eggs (your choice of how it's cooked) & comes with corn bread as well. The portions are large so he could barely finish his 3rd chicken. He loved and thought the chicken was delicious as well. 

I'm impressed with this restaurant & will probably return when I need a little Soul in me. Lol

My husband and I went here on Valentine's Day for breakfast. Since we were the only one's there it was really intimate. We ordered the Chicken n Waffle breakfast, VERY GOOD. We will go back again but it will be for dinner. :)

I called around 1 to place an order. The first person that answered asked me to hold, and then I suddenly heard a dial tone after being on hold for 2 mins. I called back only to find they ran out of ox tails already... they open at 11 and are running out of food at 1? Very disappointing.

Ate there four times in two weeks. I had Red Snapper, greens, potato salad and mac n cheese twice. I also had fried chicken two sides of greens and red beans and rice. Oxtails and gotta say I love the cornbread! So good!!! 

Service was cool, our waitress was very personable and funny, The chef over heard me talking about the food, came out introduced himself and we cracked a few jokes. It truly was good home cooking. Food came out fast and steaming hot just like I it!

The music is good, the food is better, but the sweet tea made me really sad. We were looking forward to freshly brewed sweet tea when we saw a soul food restaurant on Yelp.... but they use that pre-made bag tea called Peak & it's awful! 

The meatloaf, mac, & catfish are amazing!

The food is delicious, home cooked , and right on the money every time . My husband and I go here often . The staff is wonderful they are very efficient, though it may be a bit of a wait when they're busy , it is so worth it !

It gets no better. If your looking for spectacular soul food, EllaEm's is the spot. If you're in the Las Vegas area, make time to stop by this place. EVERYTHING on the menu is amazing. I can't speak highly enough of this place.
Nice decor, very friendly staff. Service was quite good even with 70% or so occupancy. Catfish with greens and black eyed pease were right on point. I will go back.

First off, I am one picky SOB and do not take my soul food lightly. I was skeptical of Ella Ems like I am of all restaurants.  Since this was my first visit I asked the woman behind the counter what she recommended. I went with her recommendation and ordered the ox tails with collard greens, red beans and rice wth gravy.  I ordered my food to go because I left my boxer out of his crate and don't know if he will destroy anything.

Let me tell you every dish was seasoned and cooked to perfection. Beans, greens, oxtails and rice. The gravy was also delicious. The only thing I did not care for was the cornbread muffin. It is too sweet for my liking, it is closer to cornbread cake. If the cornbread was more savory I would have given 5 stars. 

The staff yet needs to be evaluated from a dine in standpoint and I will do that on my next visit. Yes I will be back. This establishment is definitely worth visiting. What are you waiting for, go!

And now, the idis.....

This place has only been open for about two weeks.  I had the liver and onions with yams, green beans, and peach cobbler.  You will leave full, but you will not have enough for a doggie bag because the portions are smaller than normal.  I think it is because they are new.  On another note, you get three sides and a small piece of cornbread with your entree.  I was shocked that we got three sides.  My guess is that once EllaEm's turn a profit, the portions will increase which is understandable.  I must say that my liver and onions were the best I've ever eaten.  Everything was d-e-l-i-c-i-o-u-s!  The service was outstanding as well.  I can see that they are really focusing on customer service.  In contrast to ALL of the other local soul food joints in Vegas, they have the cleanest/nicest dining room.  This place will get my business and my support because they are trying to do it right.

First off, I loved the whole atmosphere of this place! It's a real small, family owned spot that's kind of tucked away in a shopping center and easy to miss. This may just be me but the interior has a 50's diner kinda feel with the red & chrome which I thought was cool. They also keep their restaurant really clean and that's a huge plus.

We ended up going fry crazy haha. I went with the catfish and my wife picked the fried chicken, and let me tell you...they know how to fry food at this place! Both the chicken and fish were fried completely even to a perfect gold brown. The catfish was unbelievable! It's cooked just right with that "oh, so good" tender flakiness and their seasoning is dead on. Not too heavy with a little kick and just enough flavor to compliment the fish. The chicken was pretty dang good too but it had a slight flour taste which could probably even out with a little more salt. They aren't skimpy with portions either...alongside the fish or chicken, you get 3 sides and cornbread. Their mac n cheese is just ok but they have really good greens, red beans and the cornbread was definitely up in the top compared to most places in town.

Easily one of the top spots to go to if you're looking for good fried food! They have amazing food with a good selection and with the portions you get, the price is hard to beat. We went in at about 8pm on Friday and they were getting slammed with customers so I really think they could benefit from staying open a little later. It felt like we were being slightly rushed which is why I'd give them 4 stars but I'll definitely be coming back for more!

Great customer service and the food was on point. I had the Mac n cheese, fried cabbage and red snapper fish, it was seasoned perfectly, you get a good amount of food for a very reasonable price. I definitely will be back

Food that makes you Happy!!! Me and My Husband went here for lunch. We ordered the Oxtails, Fried Okra, Potato Salad,And Cabbage. Everything was Delicious!!! Excellent Customer Service. I will Definitely be Back! Can't wait to try the Pork Chops!

Tradition. That is what this cute soul food cafe is steeped in. The menu is a tribute to a lovely NOLA influenced granny, RIP, who lived to the ripe old age of 97 1/2 and who apparently was a gifted cook.  These are her recipes. Consider yourself honored to meet her through her granddaughter's perseverence to share her food.

Located on the north end of town, near Nellis AFB, this is a very attractive, clean, spacious eating establishment that should be taken seriously by locals and travellers as well. It is desireable not only for the food but for its location far from the craziness that is downtown and on the Strip. This is in the land of copius parking and chill attitude.

The Catfish has a lovely cornmeal crunch, not at all greasy. It comes with great tasting tartar sauce and your choice of 3 sides.  The servings were so big I felt I was looking at them thru a magnifying glass.

The braised oxtail came with 3 pcs as big as a fist and a choice of two sides. The meat was fall off the bone tender, and the pan gravy was plate lickable.

Even the cornbread muffin was unique with an interesting crusty muffin top. Served with REAL butter.

My mac n cheese side (oh my goodness wonderful) was made exactly as I crave, with lots of the right kind of cheddar cheese.

The collard greens were tender and hammy and tangy. Oh so good.

Then there was the fried cabbage with bacon.  I could eat that all day long.

And yep, Mr B indulged in tasty Black Eyed Peas.

I didn't, but if you want to see what all the hype is over chitterlings, you don't have to go down South. They have them here.

They offer excellent service and a delightfully cheerful vibe.

You have no idea what authentic soul food is about until you come here.  I have tried many places, but this ranks #1 for me.  I would definitely go out of my way to eat here again.

Once I moved in with my mom. I started eating at this place very frequently, I have tried their fried catfish, baked chicken with light/dark gravy, I love their collard greens, mac & cheese, yams (taste like candy) potato salad, red beans & rice, French fries. My mom loves their fried porkchops and okra! She's from down south so it's very hard to find fried okra! I LOVE their corn bread muffins, they always hook me with extra when I ask! My daughter loves their catfish, she won't eat anything else besides the corn bread. If my 3-year-old likes it, WE LOVE IT! Ladies are always sweet to me when I dine-in or pick up my food.

i would like to give a big shout to ellaem's!!!
the food was delicious, the portion size was just right & so was the price. my server tim was great!!!!! best soul food i had so far in vegas.....

Service: I think the service went from good, to great after we got to chatting for a few. The guy who took our order seemed maybe busy at first while taking our order. When he asked me certain questions I wanted his opinion as to what was better in his opinion. Later he came and joked with me and had a nice smile on his face. 

Food: wow! I loved the food from here and so did the rest of the family. From our main dish all the way down to all the different sides they were all delicious! Not 1 bland item on the plate! I will 100% be going back for more!!!!

5 stars! Oh my if you're looking for great fresh and hot Down home SoulFood 
look no farther you have came to the right place. This past Sunday, Oct. 6 2013 my mother and I came in here from church I order the catfish dinner with my choice of three sides: rice with beef gravy, collard greens and yams. Everything was dellicous the only downside if you can even call it that is the small potion of cornbread.  Maybe their trying to help us save on calories? lol I  could tell by looking at it that it was going to be awesome which it was. Next time I'll  order more cornbread I was in a bit of a hurry due to having goceries in the car.

In Vegas for a few days....my boyfriend had been telling me about this establishment and it did not disappoint!!  Excellent food, friendly service and a bomb music playlist during the lunch hour.  We WILL return!!!

Terrible service. We were recommended this spot by a friend so we gave it a shot after a long day of apartment hunting. We walked in and immediately got a good vibe from this place. Good music playing, food smelled delicious, & we were the only other couple in the restaurant waiting for our food. Unfortunately we waited 1 hour 20 mins until we called it quits! Yes, over a hour! We were too busy looking at the houses &a apartments we saved on our phone to even notice we were waiting that long. The restaurant then had a little crowd and people started getting their food before us. And trust, we played out every explanation...there was no excuse for that terrible service. Things happen, I know...but at LEAST come to our table and let us know what the hold up is. So disappointed. I lowkey think they had a problem with us but I'm not going to get into that! Idk maybe they didn't, but you see, their service was so bad it's got me making up reasons in my head lol I mean there is no other explanation for their trash service. We walked out. I've been working on my temper too so I didn't make a scene. I told my friend about their trash service and he then replied " oh yeah, they are hella slow man. I forgot to tell you that." Lol Order ahead if you dare to go to this place. We'll find another soul food spot though. MF got me hot!!!!
We enjoyed the food & service.  We had the chicken & waffles, catfish, and country steak.  No complaints here. My kids loved the mac n cheese.  Love the cornbread too.  We'll be back again.

I forgot to add what happened when I stopped by to discuss my rotten food. 
The young lady that spoke to me was kind. She offered to give me a replacement chicken breast on the spot. I stated, "so you're expecting me to order more food to go with the chicken breast? It's 10:00am." She said ok. Well that's the best I can do. She smiled and I left. 
I have not returned.

We were driving through Vegas on the was to Phoenix and found Ella's. Great food and service! Even though I didn't order any they had chitlins on the menu!!!!!! I would recommend this restaurant to anyone!!!

Ok. So I've tried this pace twice now... and several months apart between visits and it's pretty good... the prices are kinda steep... and for ox tail on the east coast you get WAY MORE for what they charge here .. but overall the food is decent... not by any means the best but far from the worst. . Location is not to bad either ... dining area is kinda small but inviting in a homely kinda way.... both times I encountered friendly counter staff ... that were patient thru my indecisiveness. .which is why the extra star on food and price alone I'd give a 3 but customer service goes a long way...

We went to Ella Em's on a Friday afternoon and had lunch. Loved everything! We had the special $8.00 dollar lunch. I had fried chicken with two sides and a corn bread. The wait staff were all friendly and attentive every though it was a little crowded.
My absolute favorite soul food in all of Las Vegas. Divine. Grateful for the legacy left behind.

Ox tails, mac&cheese, fried cabbage, potato salad & to top it off GRANNY'S GERMAN CHOCOLATE CAKE!!!! YUMMY YUMMY IN MY TUMMY!!! :) not to forget bout the awesome service & the cleanliness of the restaurant, but the food really is delicious!!!
one of the best catfish i've had.  i've tried so many and this one had so much flavor and yumminess.  will definitely be going back!

We had a late lunch here a few weeks ago and it blew us away! So good. Friendly staff and great food. Much better than M&M Soul Food. Better prices and better tasting food.

I don't need to have the staff at a soul food restaurant serve me wearing tuxedo shirts and bowties like they do at M&M. 

We will return often to EllaEm's!

Just left this place. Other people arrived after us started receiving their food before us. 40 minutes later a waitress comes to our table asking us how are we going to pay because there credit card machine is down. How convenient? She lets us know there's an ATM across the street. I didn't see her ask other customers. At this point we still haven't received our food. We left so if yall are reading this those 2 water downed drinks are on you. We were in Vegas on vacation and trying to support a black owned business. Just going to eat at a restaurant on the strip since they appreciate OUR money.

I wish I listened to Nelson Q's review. Spot on!!! 
I was extremely disappointed with the food here. While it wasn't necessarily terrible, it was not good. And what's worse, it was WAY overpriced! $16 for a few pieces of catfish (eh), lame ass Mac n cheese, watery potato salad. The corn bread muffin was dis-gus-ting!!!! However, the fried okra was pretty damn good. I liked that best. 
The catfish had nice enough flavor but wasn't crispy and delicious like I was expecting. The Mac and cheese was worse than a box. I mean horrible. So much so, they should stop making it. ($7 for a large side......whaaaaaaaat!!!!!!)
I didn't care for the potato salad. Had huge chunks of egg whites in it. Ew. Me no likey. 
And, it was watery. How the hell is potato salad watery?? The corn bread muffin was embarrassing. How can you mess that up? This place is closer to 1 star, but the okra was pretty tasty. Beware if you come here. Keep your expectations low and you might enjoy.

Everything's we ordered was amazing.. from the chicken and waffles to the oxtails, greens, and potato salad, to the country fried steak, yams, and dressing. We danced to the old school music and received EXCELLENT service

Although it is small and you will probably have a wait when you visit, it is well worth it! The food is amazing and wonderfully seasoned but even more importantly the service was superb which is VERY important in my eyes ! Great job!!!!

My trip to Ella Em's was delightful. Not to mention, I brought with me a friend from the South. She enjoyed herself too!

I got the fried shrimp and she got the baked chicken. Not too greasy and the chicken slipped right off the bone.. It was amazing! 

My sides were fried okra, steamed veggies and rice and gravy. All of them were delicious. The steamed veggies were a treat because they tasted fresh and not mushy in any way.

We got a to go box and they got us water to go which was so sweet of them because it's over 113 degrees outside. They even left a sweet note on my bill. Definitely look forward to coming back here!
The food was horrible!!! Macaroni was mushy, black eye peas were bland and the greens were cold!!! The potato salad wasn't even good. I give this place 4 thumbs down!!!
Food was so delicious. Service was awesome! Cornbread moist. Meatloaf was perfect and friend chicken was so good.

Had dinner here with my daughter, the food and service was great! Very clean, has a nice southern atmosphere,  we were greeted as soon as we stepped in, enjoyed the music. Definitely will be returning!

This place is a beautiful touch of soul,the food is very flavorful I  love the chops this place is not expensive at all you get a good bang for your buck. However the reason I  give this place 4 stars instead of 5 is I've missed out getting food because they don't answer the phone sometimes.

Amazing food and great customer service. I got the catfish lunch special with 2 sides. My mother got the red snapper lunch special. We had Timothy as a waiter and he was great!! Will definitely  come back soon.

Are there any decent Soul Food restaurants in Vegas??? I've slowly lost any remaining hope after stopping in at EllaEm's. SOUL is something that our food most definitely was missing that evening

When we arrived, the restaurant was very clean and looked more inviting than other soul food spots we've dined at(Kathy's, M&M)even the items on the menu looked very appetizing....Looks were definitely deceiving here because after our waitress assured us that everything was delicious, wifey asked "are your ribs juicy and fall-off-the-bone?"
"Oh yeah" she replied with a smile...about 10 seconds later, wifey sees liver and onions on the menu and she excitedly orders that instead.
"Oh, you know what? that's the only item we don't have" waitress says....
Gee, thanks for the "heads up" on what you're out of.

So she orders the Ribs with 3 sides-mashed potatoes, yams, and mac and cheese and I go with one of their house specialities, Chicken and Waffles. While waiting for our order, we hear BEEP, BEEP, BEEP at least 4-5 times...yes,  that dreadful sound of the microwave was a definite"Oh hell's no!" moment....The cornbread comes out first, but not in huge squares as pictured in the menu, but more like 3-inch circles, 1/2 inch high....WTH? 4 and 5 star reviews????Really????

Some dude named Pedro was the only cook in the kitchen and I know for a fact, he didn't even take the time nor the patience to turn out tasty Soul Food....makes you wonder how much truth there is to the EllaEm's story and its two patriarchs, Ella Rea Gray, and Aem Upachak(photo of story included)

All of the sides and the waffles were definitely nuked,which made the waffles tough and spongy and the ribs were tough, dried out and not juicy at all. We won't be  coming back here...ever. Serving food like that is totally doing the two matriarchs a great injustice...ALOHA!!!


YELP 365 CHALLENGE-(25/365) "No soul at all"

Southern food is an art. I use the term southern, whereas EllaEm's and many of the cafes of this type in town use Soul Food. I believe they are synonymous as both southern and soul food share almost all aspects. They most unifying similarity is they are both born out of poverty, and this is what makes southern/soul food an art. It is easy to make a fantastic meal when you have the finest cuts of meat and important spices with which to flavor the food. However, when you have to create magic from the poorest cuts of meat, vegetables that are easy to grow and considered common, and your spice palate consist of little more than salt, pepper and broth that is the example of a true artist. It is easy to paint when you have all the paints and a fine canvas, but to create something out of nothing with almost nothing shows real talent. 

EllaEm's is artistry on display. It is fine southern food with flavor to spare. This is not a diet conscious restaurant where calories can be counted. It is instead a representation of a culture where food is used as an offering of love, and often the best of times happen around a dinner table. There is little pomp, and no circumstances here, just good food at a reasonable price...well mostly reasonable. 

On my first visit I had the fried chicken (dark meat), fried cabbage, red beans and rice, mashed potatoes and gravy, and two corn muffins (my heart will never forgive me). The chicken was excellent, very moist and fresh with a good crispy crust. My one of only two complaints from the evening was there were only two pieces of dark meat chicken. The sides made it more than enough for a fulfilling meal, but one more piece of chicken would have made me feel better about the order. The red beans and rice were good, but not great. The mashed potatoes with chicken gravy were to die for. I must return to have the chicken and waffles with chicken gravy (for which my heart will once again curse me). I had the fried cabbage at the suggestion of my friendly and courteous, albeit somewhat slow, server (second small complaint) . The cabbage was perhaps the best part of the meal, and would win hands down if not for the corn muffin. Go ahead and order two at the start because one is just not going to cut it. 

I would like to give EllaEm's 4.5 stars because of the two small discrepancies I mentioned above. I rounded up instead of down because ElleEm's is exactly the type of business I, and I hope you, like to support. It is local owned, not in a fancy location, and providing a good service at a reasonable price. I big you if you are wanting a good meal with a distinct American cultural edge, chose ElleEm's over any one of the worthless and "soulless" chain restaurants which litter our city. It adds wonderfully to the burgeoning community Vegas has so long needed.

Sometimes you just need some soul food in your life. We came here pretty much at closing and there was no problems.. no "the kitchen is closed we are sorry" we were greeted very nicely..thank goodness! because I really wanted soul food that night. The food was good, but the service was amazing!!! Jaz (I think was her name) was very good. So overall I think I would come back here when I am in town. Thanks!

I'm rarely in the area and was joined by fellow Yelper Andy T.  to check the place out. Can't recall what else I had aside from the chitlins but I know, we've had better. Nothing really remarkable. I've been to M&M in Los Angeles and Kathy's (prior to their move) to name a few which were much better experiences for Soul Food in my opinion.

Some of the best soul food I've ever had. I ordered the lunch special for 9.99 and got 3 filets of catfish and two sides. I had to take a Box full of food home. Very quick service and food was great. Would highly recommend this to anyone if your looking for home Cooked food.

The Best Soul Food I have ever tasted!!!! Ohhh and them large meaty oxtails with gravy is fire!!!!
Definetly one of my favorite spots!! Must try!! They over pack your plate!

A - Service
A - Food
A - Time
A - Price (Better with Groupon)

Best experience.  Writing this from table.

They say best of Las Vegas more like the worst. 

First the largest pictures are on the wall are very political. 

They don't brew their own their own tea. 

They don't give you real butter with the corn bread you only option is warm margarine. 

The Red Snapper isn't Red Snapper it is a Taiwan "farm fish" that isn't close. 

The chicken came out raw and when it was sent back was burnt neither time was it Good to eat. 

Then the meatloaf was very dry and over cooked. 

The only good thing here was ice water. 

Much better places that have soul food in Vegas. M&M, Lola's, Southern Eatery just to name a few.
Great southern Ms style soul food. Huge portions. You may wanna consider sharing. Love the smothered chicken.

I have eaten at EllaEm's a few times.  So far my experience has been a very good one.  The fried catfish, fried chicken wings, yams and collard greens are delicious!  I normally go during the day.  The staff is also very pleasant and accommodating every time I go.

First off, I lived in the South nearly all of my life and grew up in Kentucky. I lived in Mississippi and I spent many weekends in New Orleans so I know what "Soul Food" is supposed to taste like. Anyhoot...The first time we patronized this establishment our food was less than we expected both in quality and was overpriced. So, we tried this place again thinking that our first visit was just a mediocre semi bad day. Unfortunately...the food was not palatable. The chicken was not completely done and you can take my word based on personal experience that if you eat chicken that is not completely baked or boiled or whatever you will get sick. Also...my cobbler was average at best and between 2 of us we still left half the desert uneaten. Oh well. At best this place is hit or miss and not much to write home about.

Delicious! Started off with a sweet tea, then I ordered the liver and onions, and my friend ordered the fried chicken and gravy. My sides were black eyed peas, fried cabbage, and collard greens. The liver and onions was smothered in gravy, and very tasty. Not too salty, and not bland. There was a lot of food for a great price- I ended up taking most of my sides home, which were very good warmed up the next day.

The food is a little pricy but it really is good. Cornbread was great, greens on point, catfish is fried perfectly. It wasn't mushy, soggy, overcooked, or bland. The fish was crispy on the outside and flaky within and well seasoned. I wasn't a fan of the pork chops but seeing as to how good everything else was, maybe it just was an off day. Maybe it's just my preference. Soul food is always a hard thing to do perfectly for others because you grow up with certain recipes or cooking it the way you love it. What I will say is...check your preference at the door and enjoy the food because it really is delicious.
Awesome food, amazing atmosphere and wonderful service. Tasha was great! I had fried chicken, red beans/rice, and mac n cheese! Delish
Still my favorite soul food spot in Vegas! Every time family comes to visit we always take them to EllaEm's..... We haven't gotten a bad review yet. The service the food is awesome.
I've eaten here twice in the past week with my family. Food is great and service is wonderful.
The food was good but not what I expected. The serving sizes are great, one entree will feed two. I'd revisit, just not as often as I initially thought I would.

My fiancé and I had a heavy craving for soul food and decided to try something closer to home rather than our usual spot. 

We got there around 1:00pm give or take 5 minutes. We waited about 15 minutes since tables had to be cleaned. Which was no big deal, Sunday lunch rush I'm assuming. We got to choose where to sit which was great. 

I loved the wall decore. It was very family-oriented and had an old school vibe with good culture behind each picture. But it got old after about an hour of staring, waiting for our food. 

I ordered waffle and wings, the fiancé ordered the fried smothered chicken, with chicken gravey, potatoes, and mac.

So an hour in for my chicken and wings and his smothered chicken. Started to get a little sour when other tables were getting their food at a faster rate, but I don't know their orders or wait time. There was a large party of 10 in also, which likely had an impact as well. So that's fine, as long as the food is good. Ya know, worth the wait. 

Unfortunately it was dry. The waffle was amazing though! But the chicken was lackluster and appeared to be overcooked in the fryer. This occurred on both our plates. Although crispy and seasoned well, it needed a lot of gravy and syrup. The egg on the side was overdone also. I ordered sunny side, got something that was viaually akin to over easy, and ended up with no yolk.

The gravy was great and the sweet tea was good. My fiancé enjoyed the mac. The corn bread was the absolute BEST part of our meal. Soft, moist, flavorful; everything it should be. 

Another plus is that the waitress was wonderful. I have a feeling she felt bad for the wait since she kept refilling our drinks to the 9s and did her best to make sure we were taken care of. Good service on her end! 

Overall, not impressed by the food, upset that I waited for an hour and fifteen, and hoping to one day give this place another chance if possible, if only for the for  bread.

I would have loved to try the sweet potato pie, and my fiancé would have ordered another mac, but we didn't want to sit for another half hour of our only day off.

If you want quality, great tasting food without busting your wallet while enjoying a great atmosphere this is the place to go. The ambience of this restaurant is wonderful. The first time I went there it felt like a family dinner after church. Normally they play classic And modern RnB music.The Catfish, and fried chicken are my favorite foods. This store gives a true taste of southern style food. I have brought many family and friends who visit from the east coast and they all are very pleased with the meal. The customer service is also great and I have never had any issues with this restaurant. They have many other great tasting food on there menus like oxtail, cornbread, and collard greens to name a few. Also there entrees come with three sides unlike most other restaurants that only come with two. The restaurant is a great way to spend a family dinner or a simple date.
Great atmosphere. Amazing food. Friendly service. Definitely a place we will go again!!!
This place reminds me of home what a great bunch of people and amazing food

Decent food.  

To go orders are routinely incorrect and usually overcooked and inedible.  Advice: Check food before you leave.

Far too expensive for the food offerings and service.  Lemonade in a plastic cup $4.50?

Occasional, rude servers.  Act like they are doing you a favor to serve you there.

Buyer beware.
Yum! Far far surpasses any bbq restaurant in las vegas! A must try and you won't be disappointed!

We went here for one of my son's birthday. It was a nice small spot. I really liked the pictures they had on the walls.  When we walked in nobody really greeted us even though one of the waitress was literally two feet away from us. We seated ourselves?. We all order sweet tea to drink. It was water down. I ordered the smothered chicken with beef gravy with rice and gravy, collard greens and yams. My son ordered chicken fried steak with french fries, potato salad, macaroni and cheese. The birthday boy ordered fried chicken salad sandwich and french fries. My food came and it was baked chicken with my sides. It wasn't smothered in any type of sauce. I asked if i can have a side of gravy for my chicken. I wasn't impressed with my food. My son said his chicken sandwich was pretty good. My other son's food was tough meat with beef bland gravy on top. He didn't like his sides at all.

This place is tha TRUTH for soul food!!  Well seasoned, large portions, friendly service. We had the smothered ox tails, black eyed peas, Mac n cheese and collard greens: FABULOUS!!
Coming back soon to try the smothered liver and onions!!  
YES I LIKE LIVER!!

They were not having a good day, the evening that l had dinner!! That's usually my biggest problem with Soul food spots, you eat one day and have a very good dinner and then you go back an everything seems like it falls off a cliff.. these places an be very inconsistent!!!! Eat at ur own risk
Everytime i go i get top service with a beautiful smile from jaz, makes me feel like im home and family. She takes care of every customer with a smile and very quick

Had a rare date night with the wife thanks to my mother-in-law watching the kids so we decided to check this place out. We passed by so many times and wanted to go but never got around to it until now. The service was great, we didn't wait too long for the food, and the food was AMAZING! Every item both me and my wife had was delicious. We were not disappointed at all. We plan on returning for sure and bringing some friends and family with us next time.

We was in town, and my friends wanted soul food, this place was on point, just as they were closing they welcome us in, and they serve us good hot fresh food, this will 1 of our spots to eat every time we come in town. Thanks for the good service and good food.

The food and service is completely awesome.. This place has the best soul food in Las Vegas. I'm talking about monster plates of collard greens, mac n cheese, porkchops and chicken. Their cornbread is sweet and very delicious. I'm looking forward of paying this place another visit. They will always let you walk out with your tummies hanging out of your shirts.
I grew up in the south. I know good food for my taste. Ellaems is fantastic. Allyson is a great server!

The food is good but not the best I've had, however I am from the South. The service was good, and fairly quick considering it's a small establishment with quite a few patrons. 
I had smothered chicken which was quite tender and juicy, with yams and okra. The yams I wasn't particularly fond of, but they were well prepared. My child had the chicken and waffles and he was a fan, I tried the waffle and it was good, light fluffy and just sweet enough. 
Overall I was satisfied and I'll go back.

This is my first time here & I will definitely be back! The food is sooo good, just like my big mama's!  The veggies are great & the oxtails are falling off the bone! The restaurant is nice & clean! Friendly service!!

They were sooooooooooo close to a 5. Dammit I wanted them to be a 5, since the last soul food joint here was a total disappointment. UGH!!!! 

Anywho, my food was GOOD!!! I initially was going to take out, then decided to dine in. I came in for lunch and they were busy. They only have about 8 four seat tables, but they utilize them all. I can see this place having a serious crowd on wknds and especially after church on Sundays. Their call-ins were jumping too. I wanted fish & chicken so the waitress suggested to do the fish lunch for $10.99, it comes w/2 sides and add the 2 fried thighs I wanted. Which is what I did. 

A cornbread muffin came out 1st w/butter. Then my lunch came 10mins later. PIPING HOT!!!! I ate the fish 1st. TO DIE FOR!!! This was some seriously tasty fresh catfish filets. No swai crap served here! Greens weren't out of a can, I did add hot sauce they were a little bland. Then I tasted my chicken, it was good, but not fried hard enough because the meat was still a little rubbery, but had it not been for that they'd have gotten 5*s. Chicken was fresh & hot, good seasoning no salt needed, just wasnt fried long enough. Finally I tasted my yams. Yummy!!! Just the right sweetness to them. This was a solid lunch for 10.99, even though I added on the chicken being greedy! 

Let's talk about the service. This 1 young lady ran the joint almost alone. She never folded under the pressure either. Phones jumping, waiting area filled. She served us hunni! I can appreciate her. She did it all with a pleasant tone and a smile. I will be back!

I said I was going to give EllaEm's 4 stars, but looking back, I don't know what they could have done better.
I went here with the work gang for a semi-going away lunch before my maternity leave. Everybody recommended the fried catfish, and although I am not usually a huge fan of catfish (what's with that gritty-like texture), I caved to peer pressure and decided to try it. Great choice! The fish itself was light and flaky and the batter was delicious and a little spicy. So good. Also, the lunch special came with 3 (3!) fillets, so that was more than enough. The lunch special ($8 I think) also comes with 2 sides, of which I chose yams (delicious and sweet, just like I like), and mac & cheese (good, typical soul-food stuff). Others at the table ordered the greens, the fried cabbage, and the mixed veggies, and the only complaint I heard was about the mixed veggies. Oh and they also brought out delicious homemade corn muffins before the meal!
The service was friendly and prompt and the iced teas (sweet & unsweet) were all delicious, too!
Overall, this place was so good that I might consider venturing up to north town just to bring my husband here!

Note to management: can you please heat up your butter or serve it in a bowl soft or something? Trying to spread those hard packets on our corn muffins almost ruined them!

This place is amazing. Didn't even make it a week without coming all the way back here for the fried chicken dinner. Ok. Left my bank card here and they were awesome and held onto it. Double win on my part. The food is amazing and the people here are the absolute best!!!

The food is good. Service is questionable depending on who's working and the drink system is quite weird. You would expect while dining in you can refill your own drink since the machine sits out near the tables. However you have to wait on your server to do it for you if they see you. While ordering we were offered kool aide (which I don't mind if I have a taste for it) or "homemade lemonade" so I opted for the lemonade since it was in the container and I was told it was homemade. THAT LEMONADE WAS NOT HOMEMADE! That was country time powder. It was too yellow! And she had an attitude when I asked if we could switch our drink. So I said forget it and switched with my boyfriend who kindly took my drink to diffuse the situation. On their menu it says it is and they have nerve to want over $3 a glass. In total for drinks was $7 on our bill. If I go back I'll be ordering for pick up or bring my own lemonade no lie! And hopefully I don't get the grouchy older lady as my server. She looks like she was having a bad day and overwhelmed.

04/15/2018 -- OMG!!!! I ordered for the first time via Doordash and I'm full and happy from the delicious oxtails and veges! I wished I could've had Ting soda but will buy it to accompany my food with dreams of Jamaica!! Thank you! Cheryl Ellis

Not sure how they earned "Best Of Las Vegas". 

Service was A1 and very genuine as hosts. This is the only positive. 

The food on the other hand was very poor as far as quality of ingredients and you could tell the chef was amateur by the way the food tasted. Overall the food was weak! Wasn't satisfied at all. Pretty much myself and two others that I was with were very disappointed. This food def wasn't cooked with love. 

I never wanted to write this review but I had to share that Thoughts and say " How can you screw up smothered chicken?" 

They just need a better cook and someone to monitor the quality standard of the dishes before they are served.
Delicious food!  The prices are great for the amount of food that you get.  My favorite item is their oven baked ribs!

Thank you Yelper's for making my Las Vegas stay a memorable work stay. My choice was easy, smothered chicken/dark meat and fried to boot with collard greens, Mac n cheese and mash potatoes....oh the mash! Truly comfort food in the desert! 
I'll be a regular here.
Had the meat loaf dinner with red sauce, mashed potatoes, black eyed peas, and mac n cheese...i have no complaints at all and I look forward to trying a few more dishes.

Now I'm not a Chitterlings type of girl... However, I have to say the chitterlings here not bad. It's better than other places I've tried. The texture is like chewing thin sliced beef. Not gummy or chewy. For all you chitterlings lovers out there...not bad, not bad!

I gotta preface this review by saying, I'm not the biggest fan of soul food. My friends and I were in Vegas for the weekend and decided to try something new and off the beaten path of the strip or downtown. Ran a yelp search and found EllaEm's. Being just shy of 10 off the strip wasn't too bad. 

I'm sooooo glad we rolled through! Got there about 2pm on a Sunday, the place was pretty busy. We grabbed a seat and quickly greeted by our waiter Q. He got our drink order and gave us sometime to look over the menu. 

I was torn by a few different items... Oxtail? Meatloaf? Fried Chicken? Fried Catfish?  Aaaaaah! I don't know! Q rolls back to take our order, my friends were ready... Fried Catfish & Fried Snapper with collard greens, mac&cheese and red beads&rice. I asked for a recommendation and Q was on point... Meatloaf with a red sauce is his favorite and Thad good enough for me! I got the mac&cheese, fried cabbage and the red beans&price!

All three of us loved our meals. The Fish was flavorful and flakey... The Meatloaf was tender, juicy and so tasty! The red sauce was peppery and the tomatoes were sweet! Great flavor with the beef! All the sides were amazing, but the Red Beans&Rice straight stole the show! We were thanking God we each ordered our own! There was no sharing at this table!

All I gotta say... I'll be back... Actually, we'll all be back! And I'll definitely open up to more soul food spots in L.A. Thank you EllaEm's and the staff!

We wanted our soul food fix so this was where we stopped (after Mario's didn't have fish steaks).  You can see right into their kitchen and I saw a Hispanic making the food so l was skeptical of what the food would taste like.  I was quickly disappointed as I found out their sweet tea wasn't home made.  I mean how can you have a "soul food" establishment without home brewed sweet ice tea???  Moving on, I got the ox tails with the sides of collard greens, Mac & cheese, rice w/gravy and corn bread muffin.  The ox tail and rice w/gravy was my favorite part of the meal.  The tender meat was falling off the bone with soft rice covered with homemade gravy (9.5/10).  The collards greens were ok.  I personally like my greens cooked a little longer (8/10).  I wasn't a big fan of their mac & cheese but then I'm picky about my mac & cheese.  I'm sure someone likes it that way (7/10). The cornbread tasted more like a cupcake than it did cornbread.  I think they used more flour than cornmeal in their mix.  My friend loved it since he likes cakes (7/10).  Would I come back?  Yes.

The food was great and so was the service. Go during lunch to take advantage of their $9.99 specials: shrimp, fried and baked chicken, fried snapper, etc. 
Military discount.
came in for the first time and had their baked chicken, greens and rice n gravy. the portions were plentiful.
Cozy diner style restaurant. Excellent service.  Delicious food.  Will definitely come back again

Today was my first time eating here. The service was fast, very nice staff. I had the meatloaf, rice and gravy, and Mac and cheese. The food was really good, large portions, but I have to say after eating some by chest began to beat really fast. I truly believe it was in the seasoning of the meat or gravy. The portions were huge so I had some for dinner. Needless to say again after eating more of the food; I experienced the same feelings. I would return to the restaurant, but I would not order the meatloaf. In essence, I loved the meatloaf and gravy, but it didn't love me back. I am simply sharing my experience..
We loved this place it was delicious  and the customer service was just amazing. We have gone back the the food and service is the same.

been going here since they opened a good number of years ago , very good soul food , they have weathered some bad years , however went back to basics , good service , the best gravy I've ever had , oxtails, chitterlings,ribs and chicken are money makers , delivery service should expand their revenue , customer base is diverse and loyal -
This is seriously my new favorite restaurant in Las Vegas. A must when you're in North town!

My friends recommend this place for lunch and I was a little nervous cause I rarely eat soul food.  when entered the restaurant i immediately got a good vibe from the place.  I ordered the Ox Tail, it was $15 but it was well worth it. The meat fell off the bone and the 3 sides were on point (red beans and rice, potato salad, and macaroni.)   I highly recommend this place.
My husband brought me in for lunch today. Highly recommend. Huge portions and very fresh. The girl that took care of us was polite and made sure we were well taken care of.

We love this place.  The smothered chicken, red snapper, greens and corn bread are delicious.  Actually everything I've had has been terrific.   Friendly service too.  If you like soul food this is THE place to go!

being married to a Southern boy, and living in the South for so long this place makes soul food  like home again I have the pork chops with collards black eyed peas and mashed taters.Great atmosphere the waiter ,waitress is wonderful it's really a down home kind of place...... now I know where my new Sunday night dinner place is can't wait till Sunday to try something else new.

Have to check this place out! We ordered the smothered pork chops with beef gravy sides were potato salad, mac and cheese and rice with gravy catfish with yams and mac and cheese. All really great! Very large portions and the waitress was helpful and friendly.

Oh man I can't say I would ever go back. I went here with my sister and well. Worst experience ever. We used to love it but when she was pregnant we went here and she was served under cooked chicken. they tried to say it wasn't but when it's still pink and a bit red I'd say not cooked. How could they serve that and let alone to a pregnant woman

What caught my attention was the batter their catfish was fried in, very tasty! As well as their chicken fried steak topped with gravy. Plus their homemade potato salad was great:)
Same'ol fried chicken and waffles.

Service is so so. Went in for an early dinner. Had to wait a while for tables to be cleaned (did not seem to be very busy either). Food took a while to come out, which is understandable, however we had to  ask for utensils.  Catfish and liver were delicious. Fried chicken was just okay. Had a funny after taste like old oil was used. Not sure if we'll go back.

The first time we ordered from here food was okay. Tonight whoever was at the register lacked customer service, they were out of everything, my husband ordered chicken and waffles when we got home the chicken was tasteless and they really had the nerve to give us a Waffle House waffle (Waffle House brands their waffles) the other food was no so good except the mac and cheese. Very sad to see a black owned small business lack as much as it did.

I received the most hospitable service. Anisha & Niecy made sure I was happy. Love those girls. I had the oxtails. I didn't need a knife to pull the meat from the bones. My side of yams and mac n cheese was great. Of course I took my leftovers back to my room. Every time I come into town this is where I will be coming to. Thank you for good food, good service and great prices.

Once again this place can do no wrong. Homemade goodness at all times. Every dish is delicious, so much so that going into a food coma after eating here is a compliment. Our server was Jazz, and what a great person. So much personality and genuinely helpful and NICE! We make a stop here every time we come to Vegas.

Experience:  This was bookmarked in my YELP and I was in the area. I convinced my friend to stop in and get Togo. 

Facility:  It's a small spot located inside of a strip mall. There were about 10 tables and chairs in the room, and a small ordering counter in the back. 

Service:  The young gal at the counter was super friendly and helpful. She helped me make my selections and even brought me my cornbread to the table while I was waiting, so I could take some medication.  
I believe it was the owner was at the counter too while I was ordering and she didn't really look my way or act friendly. She seemed like the type that is just so focused on getting the work done, she forgets to stop and smile at the customers. That's fine, as long as she is not rude, and the food is good, I'm not mad at her. LOL! 

Food:  The problem with soul food or southern or BBQ joints, is I want to taste every side dish. So I ordered a bunch. LOL! 
I got the fried chicken plate with Mac and cheese, greens, fried cabbage, French fries, and red beans. Greedy, huh??
Normally I would order the potato salad, but they let me taste a sample, and it was really sweet and had a distinct flavor I can't place, but is not my style. I like plain old, mayo/mustard/relish/eggs type potato salad. I call it southern style, but not sure the exact name. 
The cornbread (4/5) was good, with just a bit of sweetness, which I like. 
We ate the French fries (4/5) while we waited for the rest of the food. They were fresh, hot and pretty good. 
The chicken 3.5/5 was cooked well, but a tad too salty. 
The fried cabbage was my favorite 4/5, but the Mac and cheese 3/5, greens 3/5 and red beans 3/5 were just ok.  A tad bland. 
Is it bad to say I like my fried chicken, corn bread, Mac and cheese, and fried cabbage better?!  O.o

Overall: it was good, but M&Ms is closer, so I would probably just go there. 
If you're in the neighborhood, you should check it out though.

This is the best soul food I've ever tasted it takes me way back when I was a small child my uncle would cook his peach cobbler pies and put pears in them. You would dream about all good things in life my uncle was a good  cook god rest his soul this restaurant reminds me of him. So I'm loving all there foods I will try ever thing once or twice lol sincerely ellen

Mom really enjoyed the food.  

Expect extremely slow service as the management refuses to hire more than one waitstaff and cook.   The two of them were hustling as best they could while the cashier person yapped with the "carry-out" customers.

Also, they do not serve dressing of any sort.  We found that odd.

I honestly don't see how anybody can give this place anything less than a 4 rating.. Everytime my husband and I visit Vegas (3 to 4 times a year) we ALWAYS make a effort to come and eat here. This place is absolutely delish NO MATTER what u order. Service is always fast and professional and food is always Delicious and HOT... Will be coming back to Vegas this weekend and of course like Always this will be our first Stop.. Fried Cabbage and Ox tails here we come..

This was by far the best Soul food I've ever had while on vacation. I'm from the south and all the food taste just like my grandmother, great grandmother, mom aunts and uncles made the food. The collard greens,black eye peas, yams macaroni and cheese were absolutely the bomb. I'm a vegetable girl but I tried to the meatloaf, catfish and shrimp and they were good also. I've been telling everyone that if you go to Vegas you have to stop at Ellaem's. Staff was professional and the music was definitely on  point. After trying on buffet on the strip that was absolutely horrible and over priced I had to go back to my roots SOUL FOOD!!! awesome experience and I will definitely return
Enjoyed dinner tonight for sure. Catfish and fried cabbage is a must!  Oxtail with rice and gravy was also very good! We will try fried chicken next time. Fast and very friendly staff!

I am a white girl from Chicago. I don't know much about soul food but i do know BAR-B-Q!  EllaEm's has the BEST baby back ribs I've ever had (in Las Vegas.) I am surprised at some of the negative reviews here on Yelp, but thats what review are all about. 
Yes, it is hidden away in strip mall on Craig road between a Hawaiian Plate joint and a Teriyaki Madness chain. I decided to give it a try. I AM GLAD I DID!!  
 
We ordered take out because it was the day of the Emmy Awards. We wanted to eat and relax at home. We ordered the Baby Back ribs, collard greens, fried cabbage, yams and sweet potato pie for dessert. ALL ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!  the girls behind the counter were very personal and the place was immaculately clean and inviting. 

People!!! Don't be so picky, this is Las Vegas!  Sure, there are better places to eat.  However, i will definitely keep this on my TOP TEN places  to get GREAT BBQ in NORTH Las Vegas!!!

I'm not very picky when it comes to food. I like to help out local businesses instead of the chain restaurants that have a a rep for using frozen foods and microwaves.   But in this instance I should have gone to KFC or Popeyes.  I called and placed a To-Go order for a fried chicken dinner.  I was told about 10-15 minute pick up time. It was closer to 35 minutes.  I asked for cup of water when I arrived and payed for my order.  I had to ask for it 2 more times before I got it. They weren't very busy. I had read other reviews that said service was lacking, so I kind of expected it.  Finally I got my food.  It smelled delicious.  My  drive home seemed eternal. 
I got home opened my Styrofoam plates only to find that they had put the gravy on top of my 2 pieces of chicken, i had asked for it on the side.   Oh well, i thought, it could be worse.  And then it was. The gravy was incredibly salty.  My sides were bland.  And then I realized they forgot my peach cobbler. I called and they said I could go by and pick it up because they would not refund my $7.  At that point I should have left mediocre-enough alone. I picked up the medium cobbler. It turned out to be 2 small containers w canned peaches in lots of nectar and some soggy crust.  McDonald's apple pies would have been a better choice.  I spent almost $40 on this meal.  I am very disappointed and will not be returning.

One Word Oxtails!!!!!!! Omg they are the best I ever had in 43yrs honestly everything here is bomb!!!! When you fly from Portland to Vegas just for their food  you know it's real!!!! And we have done that 4 times so far.

This has nothing to do with the food. I called trying to place an order the phone rang someone picked it up and hung up, then I called right back phone rang a long time a woman answered Ella Em's please hold, held on for 2 mins then they picked up and hung up. No I  tried to give them business guess they don't need any new business.

Just wanted good old homecooked food in a homey atmosphere and it brought me to EllaEm! The restaurant was welcoming by its decor. The food was fresh home made. I had the baked smothered chicken with actual chicken gravy! How any times do you go somewhere where you are not sure what kind of gravy it is? Not here! I had chicken gravy on my chicken and my husband had beef gravy on his meatloaf! The potatoes were homemade with cream. The yams were wondrrful! And the service was fabulous! The young lady waiting the tables could not have been nicer and swifter! She made me tired just watching her! We really enjoyed everything about our dining experience! A nice welcoming place to visit and enjoy!

We were in Vegas for the Thanksgiving weekend and decided to eat here on Friday.  I had theliver and onions with yams, rice with gravy and greens and my God was it good.  It was such delious food that I called my relatives and friens you lived in Vegas and we came back on Sat.  This time I had the meatloaf, fried cabbage, and blackeyed beans and again the food was awsome.   The waitress were also very nice and accommodating.   I will definitely  be back to EllaEms.

Every picture you see is exaxtly how your plate comes out.
The BEST soul food in LV so far.  Portions were very large and super tasty! I don't eat other people's potato salad but theirs was good. Definitely recommend this place and service was good

We had a great meal here. LOVED the fried chicken ( dark meat although you can get breast meat if you prefer), fried fish, and ribs. Collard green were tasty, Mac and cheese a bit bland, yams were yummy (a little sweet for me but others liked them). Service was terrific and super nice. The only disappointment was the peach cobbler made with canned peaches and it had a soggy underdone crust. No need for dessert anyway because portions are generous. Give this place a try.

Family owned & fabulous! this place is adorable! The prices are decent, waitresses are friendly and helpful. Food service is fast & delicious! They have a lunch special for $8!!!!!!!!!! Also, chicken gravy is on point.

OMG! Great food! The collard greens and black eyed peas were better than I grew up with!  No main entrée is even necessary. .. I got the fried chicken and my wife got the ribs.  Each entrée comes with 3 sides.  My wife got the fried cabbage and Mac and cheese (e both got the greens).  I'm not a big Mac and cheese lover but couldn't help but steal a few bites of hers. Simply awesome! 
Best fried chicken in Vegas hands down!  The ribs were also good. ..
Good service with nice kids serving.  The young man that waited on us had a real passion for the food and it showed in his body language and words. 
Dumbstruck going back soon!  Next is the catfish.  Saw it on a customers table.  Looked amazing! That customer was very happy!

AMAZING!!!

I love this place! Red Snapper or Fried Chicken, greens, yams & Mac n cheese is what I usually get and it's . I've dined in twice and called in a take out order maybe 3 times both experiences went well. Customer service was great and my order is always served as requested. Check them out, you won't be disappointed!

Ella Ems is the best soul food restaurant in Las Vegas. I love the lunch special with fried catfish, collard greens, and Mac n cheese. Delicious!!! The catfish is out of this world good. Always excellent service and the environment is laid back casual. Try them out...you will not be disappointed. Other favorites are the meatloaf, fried chicken, cabbage, red beans and gravy...aww man it's all good.

The food here is excellent, I think the collard greens were the most outstanding item...really, really good!   We both had the fried chicken and it was fresh and super crispy.  

Nice environment and the servers are very lovely.
